say.c File Reference

Say numbers and dates (maybe words one day too). More...

#include "asterisk.h"
#include <sys/types.h>
#include <string.h>
#include <stdlib.h>

Detailed Description

Say numbers and dates (maybe words one day too).

Author:
Mark Spencer <markster@digium.com>
Note:
12-16-2004 : Support for Greek added by InAccess Networks (work funded by HOL, www.hol.gr) George Konstantoulakis <gkon@inaccessnetworks.com>

2007-02-08 : Support for Georgian added by Alexander Shaduri <ashaduri@gmail.com>, Next Generation Networks (NGN).

Definition in file say.c.

Define Documentation

#define IL_DATE_STR   "AdBY"
 

ast_say_date_with_format_he Say formatted date in Hebrew

ast_say_date_with_format_en for the details of the options

Changes from the English version:

* don't replicate in here the logic of ast_say_number_full_he

* year is always 4-digit (because it's simpler)

* added c, x, and X. Mainly for my tests

* The standard "long" format used in Hebrew is AdBY, rather than ABdY

TODO: * A "ha" is missing in the standard date format, before the 'd'. * The numbers of 3000--19000 are not handled well

time_t  t,
const char *  ints,

Definition at line 2864 of file say.c.

References ast_localtime(), ast_say_enumeration(), ast_say_number(), ast_streamfile(), ast_waitstream(), and wait_file().

Referenced by say_date().

02865 {
02866    struct tm tm;
02867    char fn[256];
02868    int res = 0;
02869    ast_localtime(&t,&tm,NULL);
02870    if (!res) {
02871       snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/day-%d", tm.tm_wday);
02872       res = ast_streamfile(chan, fn, lang);
02873       if (!res)
02874          res = ast_waitstream(chan, ints);
02875    }
02876    if (!res)
02877       res = ast_say_enumeration(chan, tm.tm_mday, ints, lang, (char * ) NULL);
02878    if (!res)
02879       res = ast_waitstream(chan, ints);
02880    if (!res) {
02881       snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/mon-%d", tm.tm_mon);
02882       res = ast_streamfile(chan, fn, lang);
02883       if (!res)
02884          res = ast_waitstream(chan, ints);
02885    }
02886    if (!res) {
02887       /* Year */
02888       int year = tm.tm_year + 1900;
02889       if (year > 1999) {   /* year 2000 and later */
02890          res = ast_say_number(chan, year, ints, lang, (char *) NULL);   
02891       } else {
02892          if (year < 1100) {
02893             /* I'm not going to handle 1100 and prior */
02894             /* We'll just be silent on the year, instead of bombing out. */
02895          } else {
02896              /* year 1100 to 1999. will anybody need this?!? */
02897             snprintf(fn,sizeof(fn), "digits/%d", (year / 100) );
02898             res = wait_file(chan, ints, fn, lang);
02899             if (!res) {
02900                res = wait_file(chan,ints, "digits/hundred", lang);
02901                if (!res && year % 100 != 0) {
02902                   res = ast_say_number(chan, (year % 100), ints, lang, (char *) NULL); 
02903                }
02904             }
02905          }
02906       }
02907    }
02908    return res;
02909 }

02936       int year = tm.tm_year + 1900;
02937       if (year > 1999) {   /* year 2000 and later */
02938          res = ast_say_number(chan, year, ints, lang, (char *) NULL);   
02939       } else {
02940          if (year < 1100) {
02941             /* I'm not going to handle 1100 and prior */
02942             /* We'll just be silent on the year, instead of bombing out. */
02943          } else {
02944              /* year 1100 to 1999. will anybody need this?!? */
02945              /* say 1967 as 'neunzehn hundert sieben und sechzig' */
02946             snprintf(fn,sizeof(fn), "digits/%d", (year / 100) );
02947             res = wait_file(chan, ints, fn, lang);
02948             if (!res) {
02949                res = wait_file(chan,ints, "digits/hundred", lang);
02950                if (!res && year % 100 != 0) {

02952                }
02953             }
02954          }
02955       }
02956    }
02957    return res;
02958 }

06465       snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/day-%d", tm.tm_wday);
06466       res = ast_streamfile(chan, fn, lang);
06467       if (!res)
06468          res = ast_waitstream(chan, ints);
06469    }

06473    }

06479          res = ast_waitstream(chan, ints);

06482    if (!res)
06483       res = ast_say_number(chan, tm.tm_year + 1900, ints, lang, (char *) NULL);

int ast_say_date_with_format_da (  struct ast_channel *  chan,
time_t  time,
const char *  ints,
const char *  lang,
const char *  format,
const char *  timezone
)  [static]
 

Definition at line 3349 of file say.c.

References ast_localtime(), ast_log(), ast_say_enumeration(), ast_say_number(), LOG_DEBUG, LOG_WARNING, offset, option_debug, and wait_file().

Referenced by say_date_with_format().

03350 {
03351    struct tm tm;
03352    int res=0, offset, sndoffset;
03353    char sndfile[256], nextmsg[256];
03354 
03355    if (!format)
03356       format = "A dBY HMS";
03357 
03358    ast_localtime(&time,&tm,timezone);
03359 
03360    for (offset=0 ; format[offset] != '\0' ; offset++) {
03361       if (option_debug)
03362          ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "Parsing %c (offset %d) in %s\n", format[offset], offset, format);
03363       switch (format[offset]) {
03364          /* NOTE:  if you add more options here, please try to be consistent with strftime(3) */
03365          case '\'':
03366             /* Literal name of a sound file */
03367             sndoffset=0;
03368             for (sndoffset=0 ; (format[++offset] != '\'') && (sndoffset < 256) ; sndoffset++)
03369                sndfile[sndoffset] = format[offset];
03370             sndfile[sndoffset] = '\0';
03371             res = wait_file(chan,ints,sndfile,lang);
03372             break;
03373          case 'A':
03374          case 'a':
03375             /* Sunday - Saturday */
03376             snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/day-%d", tm.tm_wday);
03377             res = wait_file(chan,ints,nextmsg,lang);
03378             break;
03379          case 'B':
03380          case 'b':
03381          case 'h':
03382             /* January - December */
03383             snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/mon-%d", tm.tm_mon);
03384             res = wait_file(chan,ints,nextmsg,lang);
03385             break;
03386          case 'm':
03387             /* Month enumerated */
03388             res = ast_say_enumeration(chan, (tm.tm_mon + 1), ints, lang, "m");   
03389             break;
03390          case 'd':
03391          case 'e':
03392             /* First - Thirtyfirst */
03393             res = ast_say_enumeration(chan, tm.tm_mday, ints, lang, "m");  
03394             break;
03395          case 'Y':
03396             /* Year */
03397             {
03398                int year = tm.tm_year + 1900;
03399                if (year > 1999) {   /* year 2000 and later */
03400                   res = ast_say_number(chan, year, ints, lang, (char *) NULL);   
03401                } else {
03402                   if (year < 1100) {
03403                      /* I'm not going to handle 1100 and prior */
03404                      /* We'll just be silent on the year, instead of bombing out. */
03405                   } else {
03406                       /* year 1100 to 1999. will anybody need this?!? */
03407                       /* say 1967 as 'nineteen hundred seven and sixty' */
03408                      snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/%d", (year / 100) );
03409                      res = wait_file(chan,ints,nextmsg,lang);
03410                      if (!res) {
03411                         res = wait_file(chan,ints, "digits/hundred",lang);
03412                         if (!res && year % 100 != 0) {
03413                            res = ast_say_number(chan, (year % 100), ints, lang, (char *) NULL); 
03414                         }
03415                      }
03416                   }
03417                }
03418             }
03419             break;
03420          case 'I':
03421          case 'l':
03422             /* 12-Hour */
03423             res = wait_file(chan,ints,"digits/oclock",lang);
03424             if (tm.tm_hour == 0)
03425                snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/12");
03426             else if (tm.tm_hour > 12)
03427                snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/%d", tm.tm_hour - 12);
03428             else
03429                snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/%d", tm.tm_hour);
03430             if (!res) {
03431                res = wait_file(chan,ints,nextmsg,lang);
03432             }
03433             break;
03434          case 'H':
03435             /* 24-Hour, single digit hours preceeded by "oh" (0) */
03436             if (tm.tm_hour < 10 && tm.tm_hour > 0) {
03437                res = wait_file(chan,ints, "digits/0",lang);
03438             }
03439             /* FALLTRHU */
03440          case 'k':
03441             /* 24-Hour */
03442             res = ast_say_number(chan, tm.tm_hour, ints, lang, (char *) NULL);   
03443             break;
03444          case 'M':
03445             /* Minute */
03446             if (tm.tm_min > 0 || format[offset+ 1 ] == 'S' ) { /* zero 'digits/0' only if seconds follow (kind of a hack) */
03447                res = ast_say_number(chan, tm.tm_min, ints, lang, "f");  
03448             }
03449             if ( !res && format[offset + 1] == 'S' ) { /* minutes only if seconds follow (kind of a hack) */
03450                if (tm.tm_min == 1) {
03451                   res = wait_file(chan,ints,"digits/minute",lang);
03452                } else {
03453                   res = wait_file(chan,ints,"digits/minutes",lang);
03454                }
03455             }
03456             break;
03457          case 'P':
03458          case 'p':
03459             /* AM/PM */
03460             if (tm.tm_hour > 11)
03461                snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/p-m");
03462             else
03463                snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/a-m");
03464             res = wait_file(chan,ints,nextmsg,lang);
03465             break;
03466          case 'Q':
03467             /* Shorthand for "Today", "Yesterday", or AdBY */
03468             /* XXX As emphasized elsewhere, this should the native way in your
03469              * language to say the date, with changes in what you say, depending
03470              * upon how recent the date is. XXX */
03471             {
03472                struct timeval now;
03473                struct tm tmnow;
03474                time_t beg_today, tt;
03475 
03476                gettimeofday(&now,NULL);
03477                tt = now.tv_sec;
03478                ast_localtime(&tt,&tmnow,timezone);
03479                /* This might be slightly off, if we transcend a leap second, but never more off than 1 second */
03480                /* In any case, it saves not having to do ast_mktime() */
03481                beg_today = tt - (tmnow.tm_hour * 3600) - (tmnow.tm_min * 60) - (tmnow.tm_sec);
03482                if (beg_today < time) {
03483                   /* Today */
03484                   res = wait_file(chan,ints, "digits/today",lang);
03485                } else if (beg_today - 86400 < time) {
03486                   /* Yesterday */
03487                   res = wait_file(chan,ints, "digits/yesterday",lang);
03488                } else {
03489                   res = ast_say_date_with_format_da(chan, time, ints, lang, "AdBY", timezone);
03490                }
03491             }
03492             break;
03493          case 'q':
03494             /* Shorthand for "" (today), "Yesterday", A (weekday), or AdBY */
03495             /* XXX As emphasized elsewhere, this should the native way in your
03496              * language to say the date, with changes in what you say, depending
03497              * upon how recent the date is. XXX */
03498             {
03499                struct timeval now;
03500                struct tm tmnow;
03501                time_t beg_today, tt;
03502 
03503                gettimeofday(&now,NULL);
03504                tt = now.tv_sec;
03505                ast_localtime(&tt,&tmnow,timezone);
03506                /* This might be slightly off, if we transcend a leap second, but never more off than 1 second */
03507                /* In any case, it saves not having to do ast_mktime() */
03508                beg_today = tt - (tmnow.tm_hour * 3600) - (tmnow.tm_min * 60) - (tmnow.tm_sec);
03509                if (beg_today < time) {
03510                   /* Today */
03511                } else if ((beg_today - 86400) < time) {
03512                   /* Yesterday */
03513                   res = wait_file(chan,ints, "digits/yesterday",lang);
03514                } else if (beg_today - 86400 * 6 < time) {
03515                   /* Within the last week */
03516                   res = ast_say_date_with_format_da(chan, time, ints, lang, "A", timezone);
03517                } else {
03518                   res = ast_say_date_with_format_da(chan, time, ints, lang, "AdBY", timezone);
03519                }
03520             }
03521             break;
03522          case 'R':
03523             res = ast_say_date_with_format_da(chan, time, ints, lang, "HM", timezone);
03524             break;
03525          case 'S':
03526             /* Seconds */
03527             res = wait_file(chan,ints, "digits/and",lang);
03528             if (!res) {
03529                res = ast_say_number(chan, tm.tm_sec, ints, lang, "f");  
03530                if (!res) {
03531                   res = wait_file(chan,ints, "digits/seconds",lang);
03532                }
03533             }
03534             break;
03535          case 'T':
03536             res = ast_say_date_with_format_da(chan, time, ints, lang, "HMS", timezone);
03537             break;
03538          case ' ':
03539          case '   ':
03540             /* Just ignore spaces and tabs */
03541             break;
03542          default:
03543             /* Unknown character */
03544             ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Unknown character in datetime format %s: %c at pos %d\n", format, format[offset], offset);
03545       }
03546       /* Jump out on DTMF */
03547       if (res) {
03548          break;
03549       }
03550    }
03551    return res;
03552 }

)  [static]

03607                } else {

03610                      /* We'll just be silent on the year, instead of bombing out. */
03611                   } else {
03612                       /* year 1100 to 1999. will anybody need this?!? */
03613                       /* say 1967 as 'neunzehn hundert sieben und sechzig' */

03615                      res = wait_file(chan,ints,nextmsg,lang);
03616                      if (!res) {

03618                         if (!res && year % 100 != 0) {
03619                            res = ast_say_number(chan, (year % 100), ints, lang, (char *) NULL); 
03620                         }
03621                      }
03622                   }
03623                }
03624             }
03625             break;
03626          case 'I':
03627          case 'l':
03628             /* 12-Hour */
03629             if (tm.tm_hour == 0)
03630                snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/12");
03631             else if (tm.tm_hour > 12)
03632                snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/%d", tm.tm_hour - 12);
03633             else
03634                snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/%d", tm.tm_hour);
03635             res = wait_file(chan,ints,nextmsg,lang);
03636             if (!res) {
03637                res = wait_file(chan,ints,"digits/oclock",lang);
03638             }
03639             break;
03640          case 'H':
03641          case 'k':
03642             /* 24-Hour */
03643             res = ast_say_number(chan, tm.tm_hour, ints, lang, (char *) NULL);   
03644             if (!res) {
03645                res = wait_file(chan,ints,"digits/oclock",lang);
03646             }
03647             break;
03648          case 'M':
03649             /* Minute */
03650             if (tm.tm_min > 0 || format[offset+ 1 ] == 'S' ) { /* zero 'digits/0' only if seconds follow (kind of a hack) */
03651                res = ast_say_number(chan, tm.tm_min, ints, lang, "f");  
03652             }
03653             if ( !res && format[offset + 1] == 'S' ) { /* minutes only if seconds follow (kind of a hack) */
03654                if (tm.tm_min == 1) {
03655                   res = wait_file(chan,ints,"digits/minute",lang);
03656                } else {
03657                   res = wait_file(chan,ints,"digits/minutes",lang);
03658                }
03659             }
03660             break;
03661          case 'P':
03662          case 'p':
03663             /* AM/PM */
03664             if (tm.tm_hour > 11)
03665                snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/p-m");
03666             else
03667                snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/a-m");
03668             res = wait_file(chan,ints,nextmsg,lang);
03669             break;
03670          case 'Q':
03671             /* Shorthand for "Today", "Yesterday", or AdBY */
03672             /* XXX As emphasized elsewhere, this should the native way in your
03673              * language to say the date, with changes in what you say, depending
03674              * upon how recent the date is. XXX */
03675             {
03676                struct timeval now;
03677                struct tm tmnow;
03678                time_t beg_today, tt;
03679 
03680                gettimeofday(&now,NULL);
03681                tt = now.tv_sec;
03682                ast_localtime(&tt,&tmnow,timezone);
03683                /* This might be slightly off, if we transcend a leap second, but never more off than 1 second */
03684                /* In any case, it saves not having to do ast_mktime() */
03685                beg_today = tt - (tmnow.tm_hour * 3600) - (tmnow.tm_min * 60) - (tmnow.tm_sec);
03686                if (beg_today < time) {
03687                   /* Today */
03688                   res = wait_file(chan,ints, "digits/today",lang);
03689                } else if (beg_today - 86400 < time) {
03690                   /* Yesterday */
03691                   res = wait_file(chan,ints, "digits/yesterday",lang);
03692                } else {
03693                   res = ast_say_date_with_format_de(chan, time, ints, lang, "AdBY", timezone);
03694                }
03695             }
03696             break;
03697          case 'q':
03698             /* Shorthand for "" (today), "Yesterday", A (weekday), or AdBY */
03699             /* XXX As emphasized elsewhere, this should the native way in your
03700              * language to say the date, with changes in what you say, depending
03701              * upon how recent the date is. XXX */
03702             {
03703                struct timeval now;

03705                time_t beg_today, tt;
03706 
03707                gettimeofday(&now,NULL);
03708                tt = now.tv_sec;
03709                ast_localtime(&tt,&tmnow,timezone);
03710                /* This might be slightly off, if we transcend a leap second, but never more off than 1 second */
03711                /* In any case, it saves not having to do ast_mktime() */
03712                beg_today = now.tv_sec - (tmnow.tm_hour * 3600) - (tmnow.tm_min * 60) - (tmnow.tm_sec);
03713                if (beg_today < time) {
03714                   /* Today */
03715                } else if ((beg_today - 86400) < time) {
03716                   /* Yesterday */
03717                   res = wait_file(chan,ints, "digits/yesterday",lang);
03718                } else if (beg_today - 86400 * 6 < time) {

03721                } else {

03723                }
03724             }
03725             break;

03728             break;

03730             /* Seconds */
03731             res = wait_file(chan,ints, "digits/and",lang);
03732             if (!res) {

03741             break;
03742          case ' ':
03743          case '   ':
03744             /* Just ignore spaces and tabs */
03745             break;
03746          default:

03749       }
03750       /* Jump out on DTMF */
03751       if (res) {
03752          break;
03753       }
03754    }

int ast_say_date_with_format_en (  struct ast_channel *  chan,
time_t  time,
const char *  ints,
const char *  lang,
const char *  format,
const char *  timezone
)  [static]
 

Definition at line 3106 of file say.c.

References ast_localtime(), ast_log(), ast_say_enumeration(), ast_say_number(), LOG_DEBUG, LOG_WARNING, offset, option_debug, and wait_file().

Referenced by say_date_with_format().

03107 {
03108    struct tm tm;
03109    int res=0, offset, sndoffset;
03110    char sndfile[256], nextmsg[256];
03111 
03112    if (format == NULL)
03113       format = "ABdY 'digits/at' IMp";
03114 
03115    ast_localtime(&time,&tm,timezone);
03116 
03117    for (offset=0 ; format[offset] != '\0' ; offset++) {
03118       if (option_debug)
03119          ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "Parsing %c (offset %d) in %s\n", format[offset], offset, format);
03120       switch (format[offset]) {
03121          /* NOTE:  if you add more options here, please try to be consistent with strftime(3) */
03122          case '\'':
03123             /* Literal name of a sound file */
03124             sndoffset=0;
03125             for (sndoffset=0 ; (format[++offset] != '\'') && (sndoffset < 256) ; sndoffset++)
03126                sndfile[sndoffset] = format[offset];
03127             sndfile[sndoffset] = '\0';
03128             res = wait_file(chan,ints,sndfile,lang);
03129             break;
03130          case 'A':
03131          case 'a':
03132             /* Sunday - Saturday */
03133             snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/day-%d", tm.tm_wday);
03134             res = wait_file(chan,ints,nextmsg,lang);
03135             break;
03136          case 'B':
03137          case 'b':
03138          case 'h':
03139             /* January - December */
03140             snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/mon-%d", tm.tm_mon);
03141             res = wait_file(chan,ints,nextmsg,lang);
03142             break;
03143          case 'm':
03144             /* Month enumerated */
03145             res = ast_say_enumeration(chan, (tm.tm_mon + 1), ints, lang, (char *) NULL);  
03146             break;
03147          case 'd':
03148          case 'e':
03149             /* First - Thirtyfirst */
03150             res = ast_say_enumeration(chan, tm.tm_mday, ints, lang, (char *) NULL); 
03151             break;
03152          case 'Y':
03153             /* Year */
03154             if (tm.tm_year > 99) {
03155                     res = ast_say_number(chan, tm.tm_year + 1900, ints, lang, (char *) NULL);
03156             } else if (tm.tm_year < 1) {
03157                /* I'm not going to handle 1900 and prior */
03158                /* We'll just be silent on the year, instead of bombing out. */
03159             } else {
03160                res = wait_file(chan, ints, "digits/19", lang);
03161                if (!res) {
03162                   if (tm.tm_year <= 9) {
03163                      /* 1901 - 1909 */
03164                      res = wait_file(chan,ints, "digits/oh", lang);
03165                   }
03166 
03167                   res |= ast_say_number(chan, tm.tm_year, ints, lang, (char *) NULL);
03168                }
03169             }
03170             break;
03171          case 'I':
03172          case 'l':
03173             /* 12-Hour */
03174             if (tm.tm_hour == 0)
03175                snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/12");
03176             else if (tm.tm_hour > 12)
03177                snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/%d", tm.tm_hour - 12);
03178             else
03179                snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/%d", tm.tm_hour);
03180             res = wait_file(chan,ints,nextmsg,lang);
03181             break;
03182          case 'H':
03183          case 'k':
03184             /* 24-Hour */
03185             if (format[offset] == 'H') {
03186                /* e.g. oh-eight */
03187                if (tm.tm_hour < 10) {
03188                   res = wait_file(chan,ints, "digits/oh",lang);
03189                }
03190             } else {
03191                /* e.g. eight */
03192                if (tm.tm_hour == 0) {
03193                   res = wait_file(chan,ints, "digits/oh",lang);
03194                }
03195             }
03196             if (!res) {
03197                if (tm.tm_hour != 0) {
03198                   int remainder = tm.tm_hour;
03199                   if (tm.tm_hour > 20) {
03200                      res = wait_file(chan,ints, "digits/20",lang);
03201                      remainder -= 20;
03202                   }
03203                   if (!res) {
03204                      snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/%d", remainder);
03205                      res = wait_file(chan,ints,nextmsg,lang);
03206                   }
03207                }
03208             }
03209             break;
03210          case 'M':
03211          case 'N':
03212             /* Minute */
03213             if (tm.tm_min == 0) {
03214                if (format[offset] == 'M') {
03215                   res = wait_file(chan, ints, "digits/oclock", lang);
03216                } else {
03217                   res = wait_file(chan, ints, "digits/hundred", lang);
03218                }
03219             } else if (tm.tm_min < 10) {
03220                res = wait_file(chan,ints, "digits/oh",lang);
03221                if (!res) {
03222                   snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/%d", tm.tm_min);
03223                   res = wait_file(chan,ints,nextmsg,lang);
03224                }
03225             } else {
03226                res = ast_say_number(chan, tm.tm_min, ints, lang, (char *) NULL);
03227             }
03228             break;
03229          case 'P':
03230          case 'p':
03231             /* AM/PM */
03232             if (tm.tm_hour > 11)
03233                snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/p-m");
03234             else
03235                snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/a-m");
03236             res = wait_file(chan,ints,nextmsg,lang);
03237             break;
03238          case 'Q':
03239             /* Shorthand for "Today", "Yesterday", or ABdY */
03240             /* XXX As emphasized elsewhere, this should the native way in your
03241              * language to say the date, with changes in what you say, depending
03242              * upon how recent the date is. XXX */
03243             {
03244                struct timeval now;
03245                struct tm tmnow;
03246                time_t beg_today, tt;
03247 
03248                gettimeofday(&now,NULL);
03249                tt = now.tv_sec;
03250                ast_localtime(&tt,&tmnow,timezone);
03251                /* This might be slightly off, if we transcend a leap second, but never more off than 1 second */
03252                /* In any case, it saves not having to do ast_mktime() */
03253                beg_today = tt - (tmnow.tm_hour * 3600) - (tmnow.tm_min * 60) - (tmnow.tm_sec);
03254                if (beg_today < time) {
03255                   /* Today */
03256                   res = wait_file(chan,ints, "digits/today",lang);
03257                } else if (beg_today - 86400 < time) {
03258                   /* Yesterday */
03259                   res = wait_file(chan,ints, "digits/yesterday",lang);
03260                } else if (beg_today - 86400 * 6 < time) {
03261                   /* Within the last week */
03262                   res = ast_say_date_with_format_en(chan, time, ints, lang, "A", timezone);
03263                } else if (beg_today - 2628000 < time) {
03264                   /* Less than a month ago - "Sunday, October third" */
03265                   res = ast_say_date_with_format_en(chan, time, ints, lang, "ABd", timezone);
03266                } else if (beg_today - 15768000 < time) {
03267                   /* Less than 6 months ago - "August seventh" */
03268                   res = ast_say_date_with_format_en(chan, time, ints, lang, "Bd", timezone);
03269                } else {
03270                   /* More than 6 months ago - "April nineteenth two thousand three" */
03271                   res = ast_say_date_with_format_en(chan, time, ints, lang, "BdY", timezone);
03272                }
03273             }
03274             break;
03275          case 'q':
03276             /* Shorthand for "" (today), "Yesterday", A (weekday), or ABdY */
03277             /* XXX As emphasized elsewhere, this should the native way in your
03278              * language to say the date, with changes in what you say, depending
03279              * upon how recent the date is. XXX */
03280             {
03281                struct timeval now;
03282                struct tm tmnow;
03283                time_t beg_today, tt;
03284 
03285                gettimeofday(&now,NULL);
03286                tt = now.tv_sec;
03287                ast_localtime(&tt,&tmnow,timezone);
03288                /* This might be slightly off, if we transcend a leap second, but never more off than 1 second */
03289                /* In any case, it saves not having to do ast_mktime() */
03290                beg_today = tt - (tmnow.tm_hour * 3600) - (tmnow.tm_min * 60) - (tmnow.tm_sec);
03291                if (beg_today < time) {
03292                   /* Today */
03293                } else if ((beg_today - 86400) < time) {
03294                   /* Yesterday */
03295                   res = wait_file(chan,ints, "digits/yesterday",lang);
03296                } else if (beg_today - 86400 * 6 < time) {
03297                   /* Within the last week */
03298                   res = ast_say_date_with_format_en(chan, time, ints, lang, "A", timezone);
03299                } else if (beg_today - 2628000 < time) {
03300                   /* Less than a month ago - "Sunday, October third" */
03301                   res = ast_say_date_with_format_en(chan, time, ints, lang, "ABd", timezone);
03302                } else if (beg_today - 15768000 < time) {
03303                   /* Less than 6 months ago - "August seventh" */
03304                   res = ast_say_date_with_format_en(chan, time, ints, lang, "Bd", timezone);
03305                } else {
03306                   /* More than 6 months ago - "April nineteenth two thousand three" */
03307                   res = ast_say_date_with_format_en(chan, time, ints, lang, "BdY", timezone);
03308                }
03309             }
03310             break;
03311          case 'R':
03312             res = ast_say_date_with_format_en(chan, time, ints, lang, "HM", timezone);
03313             break;
03314          case 'S':
03315             /* Seconds */
03316             if (tm.tm_sec == 0) {
03317                snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/%d", tm.tm_sec);
03318                res = wait_file(chan,ints,nextmsg,lang);
03319             } else if (tm.tm_sec < 10) {
03320                res = wait_file(chan,ints, "digits/oh",lang);
03321                if (!res) {
03322                   snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/%d", tm.tm_sec);
03323                   res = wait_file(chan,ints,nextmsg,lang);
03324                }
03325             } else {
03326                res = ast_say_number(chan, tm.tm_sec, ints, lang, (char *) NULL);
03327             }
03328             break;
03329          case 'T':
03330             res = ast_say_date_with_format_en(chan, time, ints, lang, "HMS", timezone);
03331             break;
03332          case ' ':
03333          case '   ':
03334             /* Just ignore spaces and tabs */
03335             break;
03336          default:
03337             /* Unknown character */
03338             ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Unknown character in datetime format %s: %c at pos %d\n", format, format[offset], offset);
03339       }
03340       /* Jump out on DTMF */
03341       if (res) {
03342          break;
03343       }
03344    }
03345    return res;
03346 }

const char *  lang,
const char *  format,
const char *  timezone
)  [static]

04040             break;
04041          case 'P':
04042          case 'p':
04043             /* AM/PM */
04044             if (tm.tm_hour > 18)
04045                res = wait_file(chan, ints, "digits/p-m", lang);
04046             else if (tm.tm_hour > 12)
04047                res = wait_file(chan, ints, "digits/afternoon", lang);
04048             else if (tm.tm_hour)
04049                res = wait_file(chan, ints, "digits/a-m", lang);
04050             break;
04051          case 'Q':
04052             /* Shorthand for "Today", "Yesterday", or ABdY */
04053             /* XXX As emphasized elsewhere, this should the native way in your
04054              * language to say the date, with changes in what you say, depending
04055              * upon how recent the date is. XXX */

04062                tt = now.tv_sec;

04065                /* In any case, it saves not having to do ast_mktime() */
04066                beg_today = tt - (tmnow.tm_hour * 3600) - (tmnow.tm_min * 60) - (tmnow.tm_sec);
04067                if (beg_today < time) {

04070                } else if (beg_today - 86400 < time) {
04071                   /* Yesterday */
04072                   res = wait_file(chan,ints, "digits/yesterday",lang);
04073                } else {

04075                }
04076             }
04077             break;
04078          case 'q':
04079             /* Shorthand for "" (today), "Yesterday", A (weekday), or ABdY */
04080             /* XXX As emphasized elsewhere, this should the native way in your
04081              * language to say the date, with changes in what you say, depending
04082              * upon how recent the date is. XXX */
04083             {
04084                struct timeval now;
04085                struct tm tmnow;
04086                time_t beg_today, tt;
04087 
04088                gettimeofday(&now,NULL);
04089                tt = now.tv_sec;
04090                ast_localtime(&tt,&tmnow,timezone);
04091                /* This might be slightly off, if we transcend a leap second, but never more off than 1 second */
04092                /* In any case, it saves not having to do ast_mktime() */
04093                beg_today = tt - (tmnow.tm_hour * 3600) - (tmnow.tm_min * 60) - (tmnow.tm_sec);
04094                if (beg_today < time) {
04095                   /* Today */
04096                   res = wait_file(chan,ints, "digits/today",lang);
04097                } else if ((beg_today - 86400) < time) {
04098                   /* Yesterday */
04099                   res = wait_file(chan,ints, "digits/yesterday",lang);
04100                } else if (beg_today - 86400 * 6 < time) {
04101                   /* Within the last week */
04102                   res = ast_say_date_with_format_es(chan, time, ints, lang, "A", timezone);
04103                } else {
04104                   res = ast_say_date_with_format_es(chan, time, ints, lang, "'digits/es-el' Ad 'digits/es-de' B 'digits/es-de' Y", timezone);
04105                }
04106             }
04107             break;
04108          case 'R':
04109             res = ast_say_date_with_format_es(chan, time, ints, lang, "H 'digits/y' M", timezone);
04110             break;
04111          case 'S':
04112             /* Seconds */
04113             if (tm.tm_sec == 0) {
04114                snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/%d", tm.tm_sec);
04115                res = wait_file(chan,ints,nextmsg,lang);
04116             } else if (tm.tm_sec < 10) {
04117                res = wait_file(chan,ints, "digits/oh",lang);
04118                if (!res) {
04119                   snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/%d", tm.tm_sec);
04120                   res = wait_file(chan,ints,nextmsg,lang);
04121                }
04122             } else if ((tm.tm_sec < 21) || (tm.tm_sec % 10 == 0)) {
04123                snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/%d", tm.tm_sec);
04124                res = wait_file(chan,ints,nextmsg,lang);
04125             } else {
04126                int ten, one;
04127                ten = (tm.tm_sec / 10) * 10;
04128                one = (tm.tm_sec % 10);
04129                snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/%d", ten);
04130                res = wait_file(chan,ints,nextmsg,lang);
04131                if (!res) {
04132                   /* Fifty, not fifty-zero */
04133                   if (one != 0) {
04134                      snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/%d", one);
04135                      res = wait_file(chan,ints,nextmsg,lang);
04136                   }
04137                }
04138             }
04139             break;
04140          case 'T':
04141             res = ast_say_date_with_format_es(chan, time, ints, lang, "HMS", timezone);
04142             break;
04143          case ' ':
04144          case '   ':
04145             /* Just ignore spaces and tabs */
04146             break;
04147          default:
04148             /* Unknown character */
04149             ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Unknown character in datetime format %s: %c at pos %d\n", format, format[offset], offset);
04150       }
04151       /* Jump out on DTMF */
04152       if (res) {
04153          break;
04154       }
04155    }
04156    return res;
04157 }

References ast_localtime(), ast_log(), ast_say_number(), LOG_DEBUG, LOG_WARNING, offset, option_debug, and wait_file().

Referenced by say_date_with_format().

04163 {
04164    struct tm tm;
04165    int res=0, offset, sndoffset;
04166    char sndfile[256], nextmsg[256];
04167 
04168    if (format == NULL)
04169       format = "AdBY 'digits/at' IMp";
04170

04172 
04173    for (offset=0 ; format[offset] != '\0' ; offset++) {
04174       if (option_debug)
04175          ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "Parsing %c (offset %d) in %s\n", format[offset], offset, format);
04176       switch (format[offset]) {
04177          /* NOTE:  if you add more options here, please try to be consistent with strftime(3) */
04178          case '\'':
04179             /* Literal name of a sound file */
04180             sndoffset=0;
04181             for (sndoffset=0 ; (format[++offset] != '\'') && (sndoffset < 256) ; sndoffset++)
04182                sndfile[sndoffset] = format[offset];
04183             sndfile[sndoffset] = '\0';
04184             res = wait_file(chan,ints,sndfile,lang);
04185             break;
04186          case 'A':
04187          case 'a':
04188             /* Sunday - Saturday */
04189             snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/day-%d", tm.tm_wday);
04190             res = wait_file(chan,ints,nextmsg,lang);
04191             break;
04192          case 'B':
04193          case 'b':
04194          case 'h':
04195             /* January - December */
04196             snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/mon-%d", tm.tm_mon);
04197             res = wait_file(chan,ints,nextmsg,lang);
04198             break;
04199          case 'm':
04200             /* First - Twelfth */
04201             snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/h-%d", tm.tm_mon +1);
04202             res = wait_file(chan,ints,nextmsg,lang);
04203             break;
04204          case 'd':
04205          case 'e':
04206             /* First */
04207             if (tm.tm_mday == 1) {
04208                snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/h-%d", tm.tm_mday);
04209                res = wait_file(chan,ints,nextmsg,lang);
04210             } else {
04211                res = ast_say_number(chan, tm.tm_mday, ints, lang, (char * ) NULL);
04212             }
04213             break;
04214          case 'Y':
04215             /* Year */
04216             if (tm.tm_year > 99) {
04217                res = wait_file(chan,ints, "digits/2",lang);
04218                if (!res) {
04219                   res = wait_file(chan,ints, "digits/thousand",lang);
04220                }
04221                if (tm.tm_year > 100) {
04222                   if (!res) {
04223                      res = ast_say_number(chan, tm.tm_year - 100, ints, lang, (char * ) NULL);
04224                   }
04225                }
04226             } else {
04227                if (tm.tm_year < 1) {
04228                   /* I'm not going to handle 1900 and prior */
04229                   /* We'll just be silent on the year, instead of bombing out. */
04230                } else {
04231                   res = wait_file(chan,ints, "digits/thousand",lang);
04232                   if (!res) {
04233                      wait_file(chan,ints, "digits/9",lang);
04234                      wait_file(chan,ints, "digits/hundred",lang);
04235                      res = ast_say_number(chan, tm.tm_year, ints, lang, (char * ) NULL);
04236                   }
04237                }
04238             }
04239             break;
04240          case 'I':
04241          case 'l':
04242             /* 12-Hour */
04243             if (tm.tm_hour == 0)
04244                snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/12");
04245             else if (tm.tm_hour > 12)
04246                snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/%d", tm.tm_hour - 12);
04247             else
04248                snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/%d", tm.tm_hour);
04249             res = wait_file(chan,ints,nextmsg,lang);
04250             if (!res)
04251                res = wait_file(chan,ints, "digits/oclock",lang);
04252             break;
04253          case 'H':
04254          case 'k':
04255             /* 24-Hour */
04256             res = ast_say_number(chan, tm.tm_hour, ints, lang, (char * ) NULL);
04257             if (!res)
04258                res = wait_file(chan,ints, "digits/oclock",lang);
04259             break;
04260          case 'M':
04261             /* Minute */
04262             if (tm.tm_min == 0) {
04263                break;
04264             }
04265             res = ast_say_number(chan, tm.tm_min, ints, lang, (char * ) NULL);
04266             break;
04267          case 'P':
04268          case 'p':
04269             /* AM/PM */
04270             if (tm.tm_hour > 11)
04271                snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/p-m");
04272             else
04273                snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/a-m");
04274             res = wait_file(chan,ints,nextmsg,lang);
04275             break;
04276          case 'Q':
04277             /* Shorthand for "Today", "Yesterday", or AdBY */
04278             /* XXX As emphasized elsewhere, this should the native way in your
04279              * language to say the date, with changes in what you say, depending
04280              * upon how recent the date is. XXX */
04281             {
04282                struct timeval now;
04283                struct tm tmnow;
04284                time_t beg_today, tt;
04285 
04286                gettimeofday(&now,NULL);
04287                tt = now.tv_sec;
04288                ast_localtime(&tt,&tmnow,timezone);
04289                /* This might be slightly off, if we transcend a leap second, but never more off than 1 second */
04290                /* In any case, it saves not having to do ast_mktime() */
04291                beg_today = tt - (tmnow.tm_hour * 3600) - (tmnow.tm_min * 60) - (tmnow.tm_sec);
04292                if (beg_today < time) {
04293                   /* Today */
04294                   res = wait_file(chan,ints, "digits/today",lang);
04295                } else if (beg_today - 86400 < time) {
04296                   /* Yesterday */
04297                   res = wait_file(chan,ints, "digits/yesterday",lang);
04298                } else {
04299                   res = ast_say_date_with_format_fr(chan, time, ints, lang, "AdBY", timezone);
04300                }
04301             }
04302             break;
04303          case 'q':
04304             /* Shorthand for "" (today), "Yesterday", A (weekday), or AdBY */
04305             /* XXX As emphasized elsewhere, this should the native way in your
04306              * language to say the date, with changes in what you say, depending
04307              * upon how recent the date is. XXX */
04308             {
04309                struct timeval now;
04310                struct tm tmnow;
04311                time_t beg_today, tt;
04312 
04313                gettimeofday(&now,NULL);
04314                tt = now.tv_sec;
04315                ast_localtime(&tt,&tmnow,timezone);
04316                /* This might be slightly off, if we transcend a leap second, but never more off than 1 second */
04317                /* In any case, it saves not having to do ast_mktime() */
04318                beg_today = tt - (tmnow.tm_hour * 3600) - (tmnow.tm_min * 60) - (tmnow.tm_sec);
04319                if (beg_today < time) {
04320                   /* Today */
04321                } else if ((beg_today - 86400) < time) {
04322                   /* Yesterday */
04323                   res = wait_file(chan,ints, "digits/yesterday",lang);
04324                } else if (beg_today - 86400 * 6 < time) {
04325                   /* Within the last week */
04326                   res = ast_say_date_with_format_fr(chan, time, ints, lang, "A", timezone);
04327                } else {
04328                   res = ast_say_date_with_format_fr(chan, time, ints, lang, "AdBY", timezone);
04329                }
04330             }
04331             break;
04332          case 'R':
04333             res = ast_say_date_with_format_fr(chan, time, ints, lang, "HM", timezone);
04334             break;
04335          case 'S':
04336             /* Seconds */
04337             res = ast_say_number(chan, tm.tm_hour, ints, lang, (char * ) NULL);
04338             if (!res) {
04339                res = wait_file(chan,ints, "digits/second",lang);
04340             }
04341             break;
04342          case 'T':
04343             res = ast_say_date_with_format_fr(chan, time, ints, lang, "HMS", timezone);
04344             break;
04345          case ' ':
04346          case '   ':
04347             /* Just ignore spaces and tabs */
04348             break;
04349          default:
04350             /* Unknown character */
04351             ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Unknown character in datetime format %s: %c at pos %d\n", format, format[offset], offset);
04352       }
04353       /* Jump out on DTMF */
04354       if (res) {
04355          break;
04356       }
04357    }
04358    return res;
04359 }

static int ast_say_date_with_format_gr (  struct ast_channel *  chan,
time_t  time,
const char *  ints,
const char *  lang,
const char *  format,
const char *  timezone
)  [static]
 

Definition at line 6575 of file say.c.

Referenced by say_date_with_format().

06583       format = "AdBY 'digits/at' IMp";

06586    
06587    for (offset=0 ; format[offset] != '\0' ; offset++) {
06588       if (option_debug)
06589          ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "Parsing %c (offset %d) in %s\n", format[offset], offset, format);
06590       switch (format[offset]) {
06591          /* NOTE:  if you add more options here, please try to be consistent with strftime(3) */
06592       case '\'':
06593          /* Literal name of a sound file */
06594          sndoffset=0;
06595          for (sndoffset=0 ; (format[++offset] != '\'') && (sndoffset < 256) ; sndoffset++)
06596             sndfile[sndoffset] = format[offset];
06597          sndfile[sndoffset] = '\0';
06598          res = wait_file(chan,ints,sndfile,lang);
06599          break;
06600       case 'A':
06601       case 'a':
06602          /* Sunday - Saturday */
06603          snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/day-%d", tm.tm_wday);
06604          res = wait_file(chan,ints,nextmsg,lang);
06605          break;
06606       case 'B':
06607       case 'b':
06608       case 'h':
06609          /* January - December */
06610          snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/mon-%d", tm.tm_mon);
06611          res = wait_file(chan,ints,nextmsg,lang);
06612          break;
06613       case 'd':
06614       case 'e':
06615          /* first - thirtyfirst */
06616          gr_say_number_female(tm.tm_mday, chan, ints, lang);
06617          break;
06618       case 'Y':
06619          /* Year */
06620

06622          break;
06623       case 'I':
06624       case 'l':
06625          /* 12-Hour */

06627             gr_say_number_female(12, chan, ints, lang);
06628          else if (tm.tm_hour > 12)
06629             gr_say_number_female(tm.tm_hour - 12, chan, ints, lang);
06630          else
06631             gr_say_number_female(tm.tm_hour, chan, ints, lang);
06632          break;
06633       case 'H':
06634       case 'k':
06635          /* 24-Hour */
06636          gr_say_number_female(tm.tm_hour, chan, ints, lang);
06637          break;
06638       case 'M':
06639          /* Minute */
06640          if (tm.tm_min) {
06641             if (!res)
06642                res = ast_streamfile(chan, "digits/kai", lang);
06643             if (!res)
06644                res = ast_waitstream(chan, ints);
06645             if (!res)
06646                res = ast_say_number_full_gr(chan, tm.tm_min, ints, lang, -1, -1);
06647          } else {
06648             if (!res)
06649                res = ast_streamfile(chan, "digits/oclock", lang);
06650             if (!res)
06651                res = ast_waitstream(chan, ints);
06652          }
06653          break;
06654       case 'P':
06655       case 'p':
06656          /* AM/PM */
06657          if (tm.tm_hour > 11)
06658             snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/p-m");
06659          else
06660             snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/a-m");
06661          res = wait_file(chan,ints,nextmsg,lang);
06662          break;
06663       case 'Q':
06664          /* Shorthand for "Today", "Yesterday", or ABdY */
06665             /* XXX As emphasized elsewhere, this should the native way in your
06666              * language to say the date, with changes in what you say, depending
06667              * upon how recent the date is. XXX */
06668          {
06669             struct timeval now;
06670             struct tm tmnow;
06671             time_t beg_today, tt;
06672             
06673             gettimeofday(&now,NULL);
06674             tt = now.tv_sec;
06675             ast_localtime(&tt,&tmnow,timezone);
06676             /* This might be slightly off, if we transcend a leap second, but never more off than 1 second */
06677             /* In any case, it saves not having to do ast_mktime() */
06678             beg_today = tt - (tmnow.tm_hour * 3600) - (tmnow.tm_min * 60) - (tmnow.tm_sec);
06679             if (beg_today < time) {
06680                /* Today */
06681                res = wait_file(chan,ints, "digits/today",lang);
06682             } else if (beg_today - 86400 < time) {
06683                /* Yesterday */
06684                res = wait_file(chan,ints, "digits/yesterday",lang);

06687             }
06688          }
06689          break;

03784 {
03785    /* TODO: This whole function is cut&paste from 
03786     * ast_say_date_with_format_en . Is that considered acceptable?
03787     **/
03788    struct tm tm;
03789    int res=0, offset, sndoffset;
03790    char sndfile[256], nextmsg[256];
03791 
03792    if (!format)
03793       format = IL_DATE_STR_FULL;
03794 
03795    ast_localtime(&time,&tm,timezone);
03796 
03797    for (offset=0 ; format[offset] != '\0' ; offset++) {
03798       if (option_debug)
03799          ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "Parsing %c (offset %d) in %s\n", format[offset], offset, format);
03800       switch (format[offset]) {
03801          /* NOTE:  if you add more options here, please try to be consistent with strftime(3) */
03802          case '\'':
03803             /* Literal name of a sound file */
03804             sndoffset=0;
03805             for (sndoffset=0 ; (format[++offset] != '\'') && (sndoffset < 256) ; sndoffset++)
03806                sndfile[sndoffset] = format[offset];
03807             sndfile[sndoffset] = '\0';
03808             res = wait_file(chan,ints,sndfile,lang);
03809             break;

03811          case 'a':
03812             /* Sunday - Saturday */
03813             snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/day-%d", tm.tm_wday);
03814             res = wait_file(chan,ints,nextmsg,lang);
03815             break;
03816          case 'B':
03817          case 'b':
03818          case 'h':
03819             /* January - December */
03820             snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/mon-%d", tm.tm_mon);
03821             res = wait_file(chan,ints,nextmsg,lang);
03822             break;
03823          case 'd':
03824          case 'e': /* Day of the month */
03825                                 /* I'm not sure exactly what the parameters 
03826                                  * audiofd and ctrlfd to 
03827                                  * ast_say_number_full_he mean, but it seems
03828                                  * safe to pass -1 there. 
03829                                  *
03830                                  * At least in one of the pathes :-( 
03831                                  */
03832             res = ast_say_number_full_he(chan, tm.tm_mday,
03833                ints, lang, "m", -1, -1
03834             );
03835             break;
03836          case 'Y': /* Year */
03837             res = ast_say_number_full_he(chan, tm.tm_year+1900,
03838                ints, lang, "f", -1, -1
03839             );
03840             break;
03841          case 'I':
03842          case 'l': /* 12-Hour */
03843             {
03844                int hour = tm.tm_hour;
03845                hour = hour%12;
03846                if (hour == 0) hour=12;
03847             
03848                res = ast_say_number_full_he(chan, hour,
03849                   ints, lang, "f", -1, -1
03850                );
03851             }
03852             break;
03853          case 'H':
03854          case 'k': /* 24-Hour */
03855             /* With 'H' there is an 'oh' after a single-
03856              * digit hour */
03857             if ((format[offset] == 'H') && 
03858                 (tm.tm_hour <10)&&(tm.tm_hour>0)
03859             ) { /* e.g. oh-eight */
03860                res = wait_file(chan,ints, "digits/oh",lang);
03861             }
03862             
03863             res = ast_say_number_full_he(chan, tm.tm_hour,
03864                ints, lang, "f", -1, -1
03865             );
03866             break;
03867          case 'M': /* Minute */
03868             res = ast_say_number_full_he(chan, tm.tm_min, 
03869                ints, lang,"f", -1, -1
03870             );
03871             break;
03872          case 'P':
03873          case 'p':
03874             /* AM/PM */
03875             if (tm.tm_hour > 11)
03876                snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/p-m");
03877             else
03878                snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/a-m");
03879             res = wait_file(chan,ints,nextmsg,lang);
03880             break;
03881          case 'Q':
03882             /* Shorthand for "Today", "Yesterday", or "date" */
03883          case 'q':
03884             /* Shorthand for "" (today), "Yesterday", A 
03885                                  * (weekday), or "date" */
03886             /* XXX As emphasized elsewhere, this should the native way in your
03887              * language to say the date, with changes in what you say, depending
03888              * upon how recent the date is. XXX */
03889             {
03890                struct timeval now;
03891                struct tm tmnow;
03892                time_t beg_today, tt;
03893                char todo = format[offset]; /* The letter to format*/
03894 
03895                gettimeofday(&now,NULL);
03896                tt = now.tv_sec;
03897                ast_localtime(&tt,&tmnow,timezone);
03898                /* This might be slightly off, if we transcend a leap second, but never more off than 1 second */
03899                /* In any case, it saves not having to do ast_mktime() */
03900                beg_today = tt - (tmnow.tm_hour * 3600) - (tmnow.tm_min * 60) - (tmnow.tm_sec);
03901                if (beg_today < time) {
03902                   /* Today */
03903                   if (todo == 'Q') {
03904                      res = wait_file(chan,
03905                            ints, 
03906                            "digits/today",
03907                            lang);
03908                   }
03909                } else if (beg_today - 86400 < time) {
03910                   /* Yesterday */
03911                   res = wait_file(chan,ints, "digits/yesterday",lang);
03912                } else if ((todo != 'Q') &&
03913                   (beg_today - 86400 * 6 < time))
03914                {
03915                   /* Within the last week */
03916                   res = ast_say_date_with_format_he(chan,
03917                                 time, ints, lang, 
03918                                 "A", timezone);
03919                } else {
03920                   res = ast_say_date_with_format_he(chan,
03921                                 time, ints, lang, 
03922                                 IL_DATE_STR, timezone);
03923                }
03924             }
03925             break;
03926          case 'R':
03927             res = ast_say_date_with_format_he(chan, time, ints, lang, "HM", timezone);
03928             break;
03929          case 'S': /* Seconds */
03930             res = ast_say_number_full_he(chan, tm.tm_sec,
03931                ints, lang, "f", -1, -1
03932             );
03933             break;
03934          case 'T':
03935             res = ast_say_date_with_format_he(chan, time, ints, lang, "HMS", timezone);
03936             break;
03937          /* c, x, and X seem useful for testing. Not sure
03938                          * if thiey're good for the general public */
03939          case 'c':
03940             res = ast_say_date_with_format_he(chan, time, 
03941                                     ints, lang, IL_DATE_STR_FULL, timezone);
03942             break;
03943          case 'x':
03944             res = ast_say_date_with_format_he(chan, time, 
03945                                     ints, lang, IL_DATE_STR, timezone);
03946             break;
03947          case 'X': /* Currently not locale-dependent...*/
03948             res = ast_say_date_with_format_he(chan, time, 
03949                                     ints, lang, IL_TIME_STR, timezone);
03950             break;
03951          case ' ':
03952          case '   ':
03953             /* Just ignore spaces and tabs */
03954             break;
03955          default:
03956             /* Unknown character */
03957             ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Unknown character in datetime format %s: %c at pos %d\n", format, format[offset], offset);
03958       }
03959       /* Jump out on DTMF */
03960       if (res) {
03961          break;
03962       }
03963    }
03964    return res;
03965 }

int ast_say_date_with_format_it (  struct ast_channel *  chan,
time_t  time,
const char *  ints,
const char *  lang,
const char *  format,
const char *  timezone
)  [static]

References ast_localtime(), ast_log(), ast_say_number(), LOG_DEBUG, LOG_WARNING, offset, option_debug, and wait_file().

Referenced by say_date_with_format().

04362 {
04363    struct tm tm;
04364    int res=0, offset, sndoffset;
04365    char sndfile[256], nextmsg[256];
04366 
04367    if (format == NULL)
04368       format = "AdB 'digits/at' IMp";
04369 
04370    ast_localtime(&time,&tm,timezone);
04371 
04372    for (offset=0 ; format[offset] != '\0' ; offset++) {
04373       if (option_debug)
04374          ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "Parsing %c (offset %d) in %s\n", format[offset], offset, format);
04375       switch (format[offset]) {
04376          /* NOTE:  if you add more options here, please try to be consistent with strftime(3) */
04377          case '\'':
04378             /* Literal name of a sound file */
04379             sndoffset=0;
04380             for (sndoffset=0 ; (format[++offset] != '\'') && (sndoffset < 256) ; sndoffset++)
04381             sndfile[sndoffset] = format[offset];
04382             sndfile[sndoffset] = '\0';
04383             res = wait_file(chan,ints,sndfile,lang);
04384             break;
04385          case 'A':
04386          case 'a':
04387             /* Sunday - Saturday */
04388             snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/day-%d", tm.tm_wday);
04389             res = wait_file(chan,ints,nextmsg,lang);
04390             break;
04391          case 'B':
04392          case 'b':
04393          case 'h':
04394             /* January - December */
04395             snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/mon-%d", tm.tm_mon);
04396             res = wait_file(chan,ints,nextmsg,lang);
04397             break;
04398          case 'm':
04399             /* First - Twelfth */
04400             snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/h-%d", tm.tm_mon +1);
04401             res = wait_file(chan,ints,nextmsg,lang);
04402             break;
04403          case 'd':
04404          case 'e':
04405             /* First day of the month is spelled as ordinal */
04406             if (tm.tm_mday == 1) {
04407                snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/h-%d", tm.tm_mday);
04408                res = wait_file(chan,ints,nextmsg,lang);
04409             } else {
04410                if (!res) {
04411                   res = ast_say_number(chan, tm.tm_mday, ints, lang, (char *) NULL);
04412                }
04413             }
04414             break;
04415          case 'Y':
04416             /* Year */
04417             if (tm.tm_year > 99) {
04418                res = wait_file(chan,ints, "digits/ore-2000",lang);
04419                if (tm.tm_year > 100) {
04420                   if (!res) {
04421                   /* This works until the end of 2021 */
04422                   snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/%d", tm.tm_year - 100);
04423                   res = wait_file(chan,ints,nextmsg,lang);
04424                   }
04425                }
04426             } else {
04427                if (tm.tm_year < 1) {
04428                   /* I'm not going to handle 1900 and prior */
04429                   /* We'll just be silent on the year, instead of bombing out. */
04430                } else {
04431                   res = wait_file(chan,ints, "digits/ore-1900",lang);
04432                   if ((!res) && (tm.tm_year != 0)) {
04433                      if (tm.tm_year <= 21) {
04434                         /* 1910 - 1921 */
04435                         snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/%d", tm.tm_year);
04436                         res = wait_file(chan,ints,nextmsg,lang);
04437                      } else {
04438                         /* 1922 - 1999, but sounds badly in 1928, 1931, 1938, etc... */
04439                         int ten, one;
04440                         ten = tm.tm_year / 10;
04441                         one = tm.tm_year % 10;
04442                         snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/%d", ten * 10);
04443                         res = wait_file(chan,ints,nextmsg,lang);
04444                         if (!res) {
04445                            if (one != 0) {
04446                               snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/%d", one);
04447                               res = wait_file(chan,ints,nextmsg,lang);
04448                            }
04449                         }
04450                      }
04451                   }
04452                }
04453             }
04454             break;
04455          case 'I':
04456          case 'l':
04457             /* 12-Hour */
04458             if (tm.tm_hour == 0)
04459                snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/12");
04460             else if (tm.tm_hour > 12)
04461                snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/%d", tm.tm_hour - 12);
04462             else
04463                snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/%d", tm.tm_hour);
04464                res = wait_file(chan,ints,nextmsg,lang);
04465             break;
04466          case 'H':
04467          case 'k':
04468             /* 24-Hour */
04469             if (tm.tm_hour == 0) {
04470                res = wait_file(chan,ints, "digits/ore-mezzanotte",lang);
04471             } else if (tm.tm_hour == 1) {
04472                res = wait_file(chan,ints, "digits/ore-una",lang);
04473             } else {
04474                res = ast_say_number(chan, tm.tm_hour, ints, lang, (char *) NULL);
04475             }
04476             break;
04477          case 'M':
04478             /* Minute */
04479             res = ast_say_number(chan, tm.tm_min, ints, lang, (char *) NULL);
04480             break;
04481          case 'P':
04482          case 'p':
04483             /* AM/PM */
04484             if (tm.tm_hour > 11)
04485                snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/p-m");
04486             else
04487                snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/a-m");
04488                res = wait_file(chan,ints,nextmsg,lang);
04489             break;
04490          case 'Q':
04491             /* Shorthand for "Today", "Yesterday", or ABdY */
04492             /* XXX As emphasized elsewhere, this should the native way in your
04493              * language to say the date, with changes in what you say, depending
04494              * upon how recent the date is. XXX */
04495             {
04496                struct timeval now;
04497                struct tm tmnow;
04498                time_t beg_today, tt;
04499    
04500                gettimeofday(&now,NULL);
04501                tt = now.tv_sec;
04502                ast_localtime(&tt,&tmnow,timezone);
04503                /* This might be slightly off, if we transcend a leap second, but never more off than 1 second */
04504                /* In any case, it saves not having to do ast_mktime() */
04505                beg_today = tt - (tmnow.tm_hour * 3600) - (tmnow.tm_min * 60) - (tmnow.tm_sec);
04506                if (beg_today < time) {
04507                   /* Today */
04508                   res = wait_file(chan,ints, "digits/today",lang);
04509                } else if (beg_today - 86400 < time) {
04510                   /* Yesterday */
04511                   res = wait_file(chan,ints, "digits/yesterday",lang);
04512                } else {
04513                   res = ast_say_date_with_format_it(chan, time, ints, lang, "AdB", timezone);
04514                }
04515             }
04516             break;
04517          case 'q':
04518             /* Shorthand for "" (today), "Yesterday", A (weekday), or ABdY */
04519             {
04520                struct timeval now;
04521                struct tm tmnow;
04522                time_t beg_today, tt;
04523    
04524                gettimeofday(&now,NULL);
04525                tt = now.tv_sec;
04526                ast_localtime(&tt,&tmnow,timezone);
04527                /* This might be slightly off, if we transcend a leap second, but never more off than 1 second */
04528                /* In any case, it saves not having to do ast_mktime() */
04529                beg_today = tt - (tmnow.tm_hour * 3600) - (tmnow.tm_min * 60) - (tmnow.tm_sec);
04530                if (beg_today < time) {
04531                   /* Today */
04532                } else if ((beg_today - 86400) < time) {
04533                   /* Yesterday */
04534                   res = wait_file(chan,ints, "digits/yesterday",lang);
04535                } else if (beg_today - 86400 * 6 < time) {
04536                   /* Within the last week */
04537                   res = ast_say_date_with_format_it(chan, time, ints, lang, "A", timezone);
04538                } else {
04539                   res = ast_say_date_with_format_it(chan, time, ints, lang, "AdB", timezone);
04540                }
04541             }
04542             break;
04543          case 'R':
04544             res = ast_say_date_with_format_it(chan, time, ints, lang, "HM", timezone);
04545             break;
04546          case 'S':
04547             /* Seconds */
04548             if (tm.tm_sec == 0) {
04549                snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/%d", tm.tm_sec);
04550                res = wait_file(chan,ints,nextmsg,lang);
04551             } else if (tm.tm_sec < 10) {
04552                res = wait_file(chan,ints, "digits/oh",lang);
04553                if (!res) {
04554                   snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/%d", tm.tm_sec);
04555                   res = wait_file(chan,ints,nextmsg,lang);
04556                }
04557             } else if ((tm.tm_sec < 21) || (tm.tm_sec % 10 == 0)) {
04558                snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/%d", tm.tm_sec);
04559                res = wait_file(chan,ints,nextmsg,lang);
04560             } else {
04561                int ten, one;
04562                ten = (tm.tm_sec / 10) * 10;
04563                one = (tm.tm_sec % 10);
04564                snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/%d", ten);
04565                res = wait_file(chan,ints,nextmsg,lang);
04566                if (!res) {
04567                   /* Fifty, not fifty-zero */
04568                   if (one != 0) {
04569                      snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/%d", one);
04570                      res = wait_file(chan,ints,nextmsg,lang);
04571                   }
04572                }
04573             }
04574               break;
04575          case 'T':
04576             res = ast_say_date_with_format_it(chan, time, ints, lang, "HMS", timezone);
04577             break;
04578          case ' ':
04579          case '   ':
04580             /* Just ignore spaces and tabs */
04581             break;
04582          default:
04583             /* Unknown character */
04584             ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Unknown character in datetime format %s: %c at pos %d\n", format, format[offset], offset);
04585       }
04586       /* Jump out on DTMF */
04587       if (res) {
04588          break;
04589       }
04590    }
04591    return res;
04592 }

int ast_say_date_with_format_nl (  struct ast_channel *  chan,
time_t  time,
const char *  ints,
const char *  lang,
const char *  format,
const char *  timezone
)  [static]

04601    if (format == NULL)
04602       format = "ABdY 'digits/at' IMp";
04603

04605 
04606    for (offset=0 ; format[offset] != '\0' ; offset++) {
04607       if (option_debug)
04608          ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "Parsing %c (offset %d) in %s\n", format[offset], offset, format);
04609       switch (format[offset]) {
04610          /* NOTE:  if you add more options here, please try to be consistent with strftime(3) */
04611          case '\'':
04612             /* Literal name of a sound file */
04613             sndoffset=0;
04614             for (sndoffset=0 ; (format[++offset] != '\'') && (sndoffset < 256) ; sndoffset++)
04615                sndfile[sndoffset] = format[offset];
04616             sndfile[sndoffset] = '\0';

04651                      /* This works until the end of 2020 */

04673                         res = wait_file(chan,ints,nextmsg,lang);
04674                      } else {

04676                         int ten, one;
04677                         ten = tm.tm_year / 10;

04681                         if (!res) {

04686                         }
04687                      }

04702             break;

04707             if (!res) {
04708                res = wait_file(chan,ints, "digits/nl-uur",lang);
04709             }
04710             break;
04711          case 'M':
04712             /* Minute */

04714             break;

04723             break;

04726             /* XXX As emphasized elsewhere, this should the native way in your
04727              * language to say the date, with changes in what you say, depending
04728              * upon how recent the date is. XXX */
04729             {
04730                struct timeval now;
04731                struct tm tmnow;
04732                time_t beg_today, tt;

04734                gettimeofday(&now,NULL);

04784                res = wait_file(chan,ints,nextmsg,lang);
04785             } else if (tm.tm_sec < 10) {

04814             /* Just ignore spaces and tabs */
