int ast_say_date_with_format_pl (  struct ast_channel *  chan,
time_t  time,
const char *  ints,
const char *  lang,
const char *  format,
const char *  timezone
)  [static]
 

Definition at line 4829 of file say.c.

References ast_localtime(), ast_log(), ast_say_date_with_format, ast_say_enumeration(), ast_say_number(), LOG_DEBUG, LOG_WARNING, offset, option_debug, and wait_file().

Referenced by say_date_with_format().

04830 {
04831    struct tm tm;
04832    int res=0, offset, sndoffset;
04833    char sndfile[256], nextmsg[256];
04834 
04835    ast_localtime(&thetime, &tm, timezone);
04836 
04837    for (offset = 0 ; format[offset] != '\0' ; offset++) {
04838       int remainder;
04839       if (option_debug)
04840          ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "Parsing %c (offset %d) in %s\n", format[offset], offset, format);
04841       switch (format[offset]) {
04842          /* NOTE:  if you add more options here, please try to be consistent with strftime(3) */
04843          case '\'':
04844             /* Literal name of a sound file */
04845             sndoffset = 0;
04846             for (sndoffset = 0 ; (format[++offset] != '\'') && (sndoffset < 256) ; sndoffset++)
04847                sndfile[sndoffset] = format[offset];
04848             sndfile[sndoffset] = '\0';
04849             res = wait_file(chan, ints, sndfile, lang);
04850             break;
04851          case 'A':
04852          case 'a':
04853             /* Sunday - Saturday */
04854             snprintf(nextmsg, sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/day-%d", tm.tm_wday);
04855             res = wait_file(chan, ints, nextmsg, lang);
04856             break;
04857          case 'B':
04858          case 'b':
04859          case 'h':
04860             /* January - December */
04861             snprintf(nextmsg, sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/mon-%d", tm.tm_mon);
04862             res = wait_file(chan, ints, nextmsg, lang);
04863             break;
04864          case 'm':
04865             /* Month enumerated */
04866             res = ast_say_enumeration(chan, (tm.tm_mon + 1), ints, lang, NULL);
04867             break;
04868          case 'd':
04869          case 'e':
04870             /* First - Thirtyfirst */
04871             remainder = tm.tm_mday;
04872             if (tm.tm_mday > 30) {
04873                res = wait_file(chan, ints, "digits/h-30", lang);
04874                remainder -= 30;
04875             }
04876             if (tm.tm_mday > 20 && tm.tm_mday < 30) {
04877                res = wait_file(chan, ints, "digits/h-20", lang);
04878                remainder -= 20;
04879             }
04880             if (!res) {
04881                snprintf(nextmsg, sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/h-%d", remainder);
04882                res = wait_file(chan, ints, nextmsg, lang);
04883             }
04884             break;
04885          case 'Y':
04886             /* Year */
04887             if (tm.tm_year > 100) {
04888                res = wait_file(chan, ints, "digits/2", lang);
04889                if (!res)
04890                   res = wait_file(chan, ints, "digits/1000.2",lang);
04891                if (tm.tm_year > 100) {
04892                   if (!res)
04893                      res = ast_say_enumeration(chan, tm.tm_year - 100, ints, lang, NULL);
04894                }
04895             } else if (tm.tm_year == 100) {
04896                res = wait_file(chan, ints, "digits/h-2000", lang);
04897             } else {
04898                if (tm.tm_year < 1) {
04899                   /* I'm not going to handle 1900 and prior */
04900                   /* We'll just be silent on the year, instead of bombing out. */
04901                   break;
04902                } else {
04903                   res = wait_file(chan, ints, "digits/1000", lang);
04904                   if (!res) {
04905                      wait_file(chan, ints, "digits/900", lang);
04906                      res = ast_say_enumeration(chan, tm.tm_year, ints, lang, NULL);
04907                   }
04908                }
04909             }
04910             if (!res)
04911                wait_file(chan, ints, "digits/year", lang);
04912             break;
04913          case 'I':
04914          case 'l':
04915             /* 12-Hour */
04916             if (tm.tm_hour == 0)
04917                snprintf(nextmsg, sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/t-12");
04918             else if (tm.tm_hour > 12)
04919                snprintf(nextmsg, sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/t-%d", tm.tm_hour - 12);
04920             else 
04921                snprintf(nextmsg, sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/t-%d", tm.tm_hour);
04922 
04923             res = wait_file(chan, ints, nextmsg, lang);
04924             break;
04925          case 'H':
04926          case 'k':
04927             /* 24-Hour */
04928             if (tm.tm_hour != 0) {
04929                snprintf(nextmsg, sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/t-%d", tm.tm_hour);
04930                res = wait_file(chan, ints, nextmsg, lang);
04931             } else 
04932                res = wait_file(chan, ints, "digits/t-24", lang);
04933             break;
04934          case 'M':
04935          case 'N':
04936             /* Minute */
04937             if (tm.tm_min == 0) {
04938                if (format[offset] == 'M') {
04939                   res = wait_file(chan, ints, "digits/oclock", lang);
04940                } else {
04941                   res = wait_file(chan, ints, "digits/100", lang);
04942                }
04943             } else
04944                res = ast_say_number(chan, tm.tm_min, ints, lang, "f"); 
04945             break;
04946          case 'P':
04947          case 'p':
04948             /* AM/PM */
04949             if (tm.tm_hour > 11)
04950                snprintf(nextmsg, sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/p-m");
04951             else
04952                snprintf(nextmsg, sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/a-m");
04953             res = wait_file(chan, ints, nextmsg, lang);
04954             break;
04955          case 'Q':
04956             /* Shorthand for "Today", "Yesterday", or AdBY */
04957             {
04958                time_t tv_sec = time(NULL);
04959                struct tm tmnow;
04960                time_t beg_today;
04961 
04962                ast_localtime(&tv_sec,&tmnow, timezone);
04963                /* This might be slightly off, if we transcend a leap second, but never more off than 1 second */
04964                /* In any case, it saves not having to do ast_mktime() */
04965                beg_today = tv_sec - (tmnow.tm_hour * 3600) - (tmnow.tm_min * 60) - (tmnow.tm_sec);
04966                if (beg_today < thetime) {
04967                   /* Today */
04968                   res = wait_file(chan, ints, "digits/today", lang);
04969                } else if (beg_today - 86400 < thetime) {
04970                   /* Yesterday */
04971                   res = wait_file(chan, ints, "digits/yesterday", lang);
04972                } else {
04973                   res = ast_say_date_with_format(chan, thetime, ints, lang, "AdBY", timezone);
04974                }
04975             }
04976             break;
04977          case 'q':
04978             /* Shorthand for "" (today), "Yesterday", A (weekday), or AdBY */
04979             {
04980                time_t tv_sec = time(NULL);
04981                struct tm tmnow;
04982                time_t beg_today;
04983 
04984                ast_localtime(&tv_sec, &tmnow, timezone);
04985                /* This might be slightly off, if we transcend a leap second, but never more off than 1 second */
04986                /* In any case, it saves not having to do ast_mktime() */
04987                beg_today = tv_sec - (tmnow.tm_hour * 3600) - (tmnow.tm_min * 60) - (tmnow.tm_sec);
04988                if (beg_today < thetime) {
04989                   /* Today */
04990                } else if ((beg_today - 86400) < thetime) {
04991                   /* Yesterday */
04992                   res = wait_file(chan, ints, "digits/yesterday", lang);
04993                } else if (beg_today - 86400 * 6 < thetime) {
04994                   /* Within the last week */
04995                   res = ast_say_date_with_format(chan, thetime, ints, lang, "A", timezone);
04996                } else {
04997                   res = ast_say_date_with_format(chan, thetime, ints, lang, "AdBY", timezone);
04998                }
04999             }
05000             break;
05001          case 'R':
05002             res = ast_say_date_with_format(chan, thetime, ints, lang, "HM", timezone);
05003             break;
05004          case 'S':
05005             /* Seconds */
05006             res = wait_file(chan, ints, "digits/and", lang);
05007             if (!res) {
05008                if (tm.tm_sec == 1) {
05009                   res = wait_file(chan, ints, "digits/1z", lang);
05010                   if (!res)
05011                      res = wait_file(chan, ints, "digits/second-a", lang);
05012                } else {
05013                   res = ast_say_number(chan, tm.tm_min, ints, lang, "f");
05014                   if (!res) {
05015                      int ten, one;
05016                      ten = tm.tm_sec / 10;
05017                      one = tm.tm_sec % 10;
05018                      
05019                      if (one > 1 && one < 5 && ten != 1)
05020                         res = wait_file(chan,ints, "digits/seconds",lang);
05021                      else
05022                         res = wait_file(chan,ints, "digits/second",lang);
05023                   }
05024                }
05025             }
05026             break;
05027          case 'T':
05028             res = ast_say_date_with_format(chan, thetime, ints, lang, "HMS", timezone);
05029             break;
05030          case ' ':
05031          case '   ':
05032             /* Just ignore spaces and tabs */
05033             break;
05034          default:
05035             /* Unknown character */
05036             ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Unknown character in datetime format %s: %c at pos %d\n", format, format[offset], offset);
05037       }
05038       /* Jump out on DTMF */
05039       if (res)
05040          break;
05041    }
05042    return res;
05043 }

int ast_say_date_with_format_pt (  struct ast_channel *  chan,

const char *  lang,
const char *  format,
const char *  timezone
)  [static]

05063             /* Literal name of a sound file */
05064             sndoffset=0;

05083             break;

05085             /* First - Twelfth */

05088             } else {
05089                snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/h-%d", tm.tm_mon +1);

05091             }
05092             break;

05097             break;
05098          case 'Y':
05099             /* Year */
05100             res = ast_say_number(chan, tm.tm_year + 1900, ints, lang, (char *) NULL);
05101             break;
05102          case 'I':
05103          case 'l':
05104             /* 12-Hour */
05105             if (!strcasecmp(lang, "pt_BR")) {
05106                if (tm.tm_hour == 0) {
05107                   if (format[offset] == 'I')
05108                      res = wait_file(chan, ints, "digits/pt-a", lang);
05109                   if (!res)
05110                      res = wait_file(chan, ints, "digits/pt-meianoite", lang);
05111                } else if (tm.tm_hour == 12) {
05112                   if (format[offset] == 'I')
05113                      res = wait_file(chan, ints, "digits/pt-ao", lang);
05114                   if (!res)
05115                      res = wait_file(chan, ints, "digits/pt-meiodia", lang);
05116                   } else {
05117                   if (format[offset] == 'I') {
05118                      if ((tm.tm_hour % 12) != 1)
05119                         res = wait_file(chan, ints, "digits/pt-as", lang);
05120                      else
05121                         res = wait_file(chan, ints, "digits/pt-a", lang);
05122                   }
05123                   if (!res)
05124                      res = ast_say_number(chan, (tm.tm_hour % 12), ints, lang, "f");
05125                   if ((!res) && (format[offset] == 'I'))
05126                   res = ast_say_date_with_format(chan, time, ints, lang, "P", timezone);
05127                }
05128             } else {
05129                if (tm.tm_hour == 0) {
05130                   if (format[offset] == 'I')
05131                      res = wait_file(chan, ints, "digits/pt-ah", lang);
05132                   if (!res)
05133                      res = wait_file(chan, ints, "digits/pt-meianoite", lang);
05134                   }
05135                else if (tm.tm_hour == 12) {
05136                   if (format[offset] == 'I')
05137                      res = wait_file(chan, ints, "digits/pt-ao", lang);
05138                   if (!res)
05139                      res = wait_file(chan, ints, "digits/pt-meiodia", lang);
05140                }
05141                else {
05142                   if (format[offset] == 'I') {
05143                      res = wait_file(chan, ints, "digits/pt-ah", lang);
05144                      if ((tm.tm_hour % 12) != 1)
05145                         if (!res)
05146                            res = wait_file(chan, ints, "digits/pt-sss", lang);
05147                   }
05148                   if (!res)
05149                      res = ast_say_number(chan, (tm.tm_hour % 12), ints, lang, "f");
05150                }
05151             }
05152             break;
05153          case 'H':
05154          case 'k':
05155             /* 24-Hour */
05156             if (!strcasecmp(lang, "pt_BR")) {
05157                res = ast_say_number(chan, tm.tm_hour, ints, lang, "f");
05158                if ((!res) && (format[offset] == 'H')) {
05159                   if (tm.tm_hour > 1) {
05160                      res = wait_file(chan,ints,"digits/hours",lang);
05161                   } else {
05162                      res = wait_file(chan,ints,"digits/hour",lang);
05163                   }
05164                }
05165             } else {
05166                res = ast_say_number(chan, -tm.tm_hour, ints, lang, NULL);
05167                if (!res) {
05168                   if (tm.tm_hour != 0) {
05169                      int remainder = tm.tm_hour;
05170                      if (tm.tm_hour > 20) {
05171                         res = wait_file(chan,ints, "digits/20",lang);
05172                         remainder -= 20;
05173                      }
05174                      if (!res) {
05175                         snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/%d", remainder);

05177                      }

05179                }
05180             }
05181             break;

05189                   } else {

05191                   }
05192                }
05193             } else {

05196                   if (tm.tm_hour != 1)
05197                      if (!res)
05198                         res = wait_file(chan, ints, "digits/pt-sss", lang);         } else {
05199                   res = wait_file(chan,ints,"digits/pt-e",lang);
05200                   if (!res)
05201                      res = ast_say_number(chan, tm.tm_min, ints, lang, (char *) NULL); 
05202                }
05203             }
05204             break;
05205          case 'P':
05206          case 'p':
05207             /* AM/PM */
05208             if (!strcasecmp(lang, "pt_BR")) {
05209                if ((tm.tm_hour != 0) && (tm.tm_hour != 12)) {
05210                   res = wait_file(chan, ints, "digits/pt-da", lang);
05211                   if (!res) {
05212                      if ((tm.tm_hour >= 0) && (tm.tm_hour < 12))
05213                         res = wait_file(chan, ints, "digits/morning", lang);
05214                      else if ((tm.tm_hour >= 12) && (tm.tm_hour < 18))
05215                         res = wait_file(chan, ints, "digits/afternoon", lang);
05216                      else res = wait_file(chan, ints, "digits/night", lang);
05217                   }
05218                }
05219             } else {
05220                if (tm.tm_hour > 12)
05221                   res = wait_file(chan, ints, "digits/p-m", lang);
05222                else if (tm.tm_hour  && tm.tm_hour < 12)
05223                   res = wait_file(chan, ints, "digits/a-m", lang);
05224             }
05225             break;
05226          case 'Q':
05227             /* Shorthand for "Today", "Yesterday", or ABdY */
05228             /* XXX As emphasized elsewhere, this should the native way in your
05229              * language to say the date, with changes in what you say, depending
05230              * upon how recent the date is. XXX */
05231             {
05232                struct timeval now;
05233                struct tm tmnow;
05234                time_t beg_today, tt;
05235 
05236                gettimeofday(&now,NULL);
05237                tt = now.tv_sec;
05238                ast_localtime(&tt,&tmnow,timezone);
05239                /* This might be slightly off, if we transcend a leap second, but never more off than 1 second */
05240                /* In any case, it saves not having to do ast_mktime() */
05241                beg_today = tt - (tmnow.tm_hour * 3600) - (tmnow.tm_min * 60) - (tmnow.tm_sec);
05242                if (beg_today < time) {
05243                   /* Today */
05244                   res = wait_file(chan,ints, "digits/today",lang);
05245                } else if (beg_today - 86400 < time) {
05246                   /* Yesterday */
05247                   res = wait_file(chan,ints, "digits/yesterday",lang);
05248                } else {
05249                   res = ast_say_date_with_format_pt(chan, time, ints, lang, "Ad 'digits/pt-de' B 'digits/pt-de' Y", timezone);
05250                }
05251             }
05252             break;
05253          case 'q':
05254             /* Shorthand for "" (today), "Yesterday", A (weekday), or ABdY */
05255             /* XXX As emphasized elsewhere, this should the native way in your
05256              * language to say the date, with changes in what you say, depending
05257              * upon how recent the date is. XXX */
05258             {
05259                struct timeval now;
05260                struct tm tmnow;
05261                time_t beg_today, tt;
05262 
05263                gettimeofday(&now,NULL);
05264                tt = now.tv_sec;
05265                ast_localtime(&tt,&tmnow,timezone);
05266                /* This might be slightly off, if we transcend a leap second, but never more off than 1 second */
05267                /* In any case, it saves not having to do ast_mktime() */
05268                beg_today = tt - (tmnow.tm_hour * 3600) - (tmnow.tm_min * 60) - (tmnow.tm_sec);
05269                if (beg_today < time) {
05270                   /* Today */
05271                } else if ((beg_today - 86400) < time) {
05272                   /* Yesterday */
05273                   res = wait_file(chan,ints, "digits/yesterday",lang);
05274                } else if (beg_today - 86400 * 6 < time) {
05275                   /* Within the last week */
05276                   res = ast_say_date_with_format_pt(chan, time, ints, lang, "A", timezone);
05277                } else {
05278                   res = ast_say_date_with_format_pt(chan, time, ints, lang, "Ad 'digits/pt-de' B 'digits/pt-de' Y", timezone);
05279                }
05280             }
05281             break;
05282          case 'R':
05283             res = ast_say_date_with_format_pt(chan, time, ints, lang, "H 'digits/pt-e' M", timezone);
05284             break;
05285          case 'S':
05286             /* Seconds */
05287             if (!strcasecmp(lang, "pt_BR")) {
05288                res = ast_say_number(chan, tm.tm_sec, ints, lang, NULL);
05289                if (!res) {
05290                   if (tm.tm_sec > 1) {
05291                      res = wait_file(chan,ints,"digits/seconds",lang);
05292                   } else {
05293                      res = wait_file(chan,ints,"digits/second",lang);
05294                   }
05295                }
05296             } else {
05297                if (tm.tm_sec == 0) {
05298                   snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/%d", tm.tm_sec);
05299                   res = wait_file(chan,ints,nextmsg,lang);
05300                } else if (tm.tm_sec < 10) {
05301                   res = wait_file(chan,ints, "digits/oh",lang);
05302                   if (!res) {
05303                      snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/%d", tm.tm_sec);
05304                      res = wait_file(chan,ints,nextmsg,lang);
05305                   }
05306                } else if ((tm.tm_sec < 21) || (tm.tm_sec % 10 == 0)) {
05307                   snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/%d", tm.tm_sec);
05308                   res = wait_file(chan,ints,nextmsg,lang);
05309                } else {
05310                   int ten, one;
05311                   ten = (tm.tm_sec / 10) * 10;
05312                   one = (tm.tm_sec % 10);
05313                   snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/%d", ten);
05314                   res = wait_file(chan,ints,nextmsg,lang);
05315                   if (!res) {
05316                      /* Fifty, not fifty-zero */
05317                      if (one != 0) {
05318                         snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/%d", one);
05319                         res = wait_file(chan,ints,nextmsg,lang);
05320                      }
05321                   }
05322                }
05323             }
05324             break;
05325          case 'T':
05326             res = ast_say_date_with_format_pt(chan, time, ints, lang, "HMS", timezone);
05327             break;
05328          case ' ':
05329          case '   ':
05330             /* Just ignore spaces and tabs */
05331             break;
05332          default:
05333             /* Unknown character */
05334             ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Unknown character in datetime format %s: %c at pos %d\n", format, format[offset], offset);
05335       }
05336       /* Jump out on DTMF */
05337       if (res) {
05338          break;
05339       }
05340    }
05341    return res;
05342 }

int ast_say_date_with_format_tw (  struct ast_channel *  chan,
time_t  time,
const char *  ints,
const char *  lang,
const char *  format,
const char *  timezone
)  [static]
 

Definition at line 5345 of file say.c.

References ast_localtime(), ast_log(), LOG_DEBUG, LOG_WARNING, offset, option_debug, and wait_file().

Referenced by say_date_with_format().

05346 {
05347    struct tm tm;
05348    int res=0, offset, sndoffset;
05349    char sndfile[256], nextmsg[256];
05350 
05351    if (format == NULL)
05352       format = "YBdA 'digits/at' HM";
05353 
05354    ast_localtime(&time,&tm,timezone);
05355 
05356    for (offset=0 ; format[offset] != '\0' ; offset++) {
05357       if (option_debug)
05358          ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "Parsing %c (offset %d) in %s\n", format[offset], offset, format);
05359       switch (format[offset]) {
05360          /* NOTE:  if you add more options here, please try to be consistent with strftime(3) */
05361          case '\'':
05362             /* Literal name of a sound file */
05363             sndoffset=0;
05364             for (sndoffset=0 ; (format[++offset] != '\'') && (sndoffset < 256) ; sndoffset++)
05365                sndfile[sndoffset] = format[offset];
05366             sndfile[sndoffset] = '\0';
05367             res = wait_file(chan,ints,sndfile,lang);
05368             break;
05369          case 'A':
05370          case 'a':
05371             /* Sunday - Saturday */
05372             snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/day-%d", tm.tm_wday);
05373             res = wait_file(chan,ints,nextmsg,lang);
05374             break;
05375          case 'B':
05376          case 'b':
05377          case 'h':
05378             /* January - December */
05379             snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/mon-%d", tm.tm_mon);
05380             res = wait_file(chan,ints,nextmsg,lang);
05381             break;
05382          case 'm':
05383             /* First - Twelfth */
05384             snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/h-%d", tm.tm_mon +1);
05385             res = wait_file(chan,ints,nextmsg,lang);
05386             break;
05387          case 'd':
05388          case 'e':
05389             /* First - Thirtyfirst */
05390             if (!(tm.tm_mday % 10) || (tm.tm_mday < 10)) {
05391                snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/h-%d", tm.tm_mday);
05392                res = wait_file(chan,ints,nextmsg,lang);
05393             } else {
05394                snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/h-%dh", tm.tm_mday - (tm.tm_mday % 10));
05395                res = wait_file(chan,ints,nextmsg,lang);
05396                if (!res) {
05397                   snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/h-%d", tm.tm_mday % 10);
05398                   res = wait_file(chan,ints,nextmsg,lang);
05399                }
05400             }
05401             break;
05402          case 'Y':
05403             /* Year */
05404             if (tm.tm_year > 99) {
05405                res = wait_file(chan,ints, "digits/2",lang);
05406                if (!res) {
05407                   res = wait_file(chan,ints, "digits/thousand",lang);
05408                }
05409                if (tm.tm_year > 100) {
05410                   if (!res) {
05411                      snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/%d", (tm.tm_year - 100) / 10);
05412                      res = wait_file(chan,ints,nextmsg,lang);
05413                      if (!res) {
05414                         snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/%d", (tm.tm_year - 100) % 10);
05415                         res = wait_file(chan,ints,nextmsg,lang);
05416                      }
05417                   }
05418                }
05419                if (!res) {
05420                   res = wait_file(chan,ints, "digits/year",lang);
05421                }
05422             } else {
05423                if (tm.tm_year < 1) {
05424                   /* I'm not going to handle 1900 and prior */
05425                   /* We'll just be silent on the year, instead of bombing out. */
05426                } else {
05427                   res = wait_file(chan,ints, "digits/1",lang);
05428                   if (!res) {
05429                      res = wait_file(chan,ints, "digits/9",lang);
05430                   }
05431                   if (!res) {
05432                      if (tm.tm_year <= 9) {
05433                         /* 1901 - 1909 */
05434                         res = wait_file(chan,ints, "digits/0",lang);
05435                         if (!res) {
05436                            snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/%d", tm.tm_year);
05437                            res = wait_file(chan,ints,nextmsg,lang);
05438                         }
05439                      } else {
05440                         /* 1910 - 1999 */
05441                         snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/%d", tm.tm_year / 10);
05442                         res = wait_file(chan,ints,nextmsg,lang);
05443                         if (!res) {
05444                            snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/%d", tm.tm_year % 10);
05445                            res = wait_file(chan,ints,nextmsg,lang);
05446                         }
05447                      }
05448                   }
05449                }
05450                if (!res) {
05451                   res = wait_file(chan,ints, "digits/year",lang);
05452                }
05453             }
05454             break;
05455          case 'I':
05456          case 'l':
05457             /* 12-Hour */
05458             if (tm.tm_hour == 0)
05459                snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/12");
05460             else if (tm.tm_hour > 12)
05461                snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/%d", tm.tm_hour - 12);
05462             else
05463                snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/%d", tm.tm_hour);
05464             res = wait_file(chan,ints,nextmsg,lang);
05465             if (!res) {
05466                res = wait_file(chan,ints, "digits/oclock",lang);
05467             }
05468             break;
05469          case 'H':
05470          case 'k':
05471             /* 24-Hour */
05472             if (!(tm.tm_hour % 10) || tm.tm_hour < 10) {
05473                if (tm.tm_hour < 10) {
05474                   res = wait_file(chan, ints, "digits/0", lang);
05475                }
05476                snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/%d", tm.tm_hour);
05477                res = wait_file(chan,ints,nextmsg,lang);
05478             } else {
05479                snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/%d", tm.tm_hour - (tm.tm_hour % 10));
05480                res = wait_file(chan,ints,nextmsg,lang);
05481                if (!res) {
05482                   snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/%d", tm.tm_hour % 10);
05483                   res = wait_file(chan,ints,nextmsg,lang);
05484                }
05485             }
05486             if (!res) {
05487                res = wait_file(chan,ints, "digits/oclock",lang);
05488             }
05489             break;
05490          case 'M':
05491             /* Minute */
05492             if (!(tm.tm_min % 10) || tm.tm_min < 10) {
05493                if (tm.tm_min < 10) {
05494                   res = wait_file(chan, ints, "digits/0", lang);
05495                }
05496                snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/%d", tm.tm_min);
05497                res = wait_file(chan,ints,nextmsg,lang);
05498             } else {
05499                snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/%d", tm.tm_min - (tm.tm_min % 10));
05500                res = wait_file(chan,ints,nextmsg,lang);
05501                if (!res) {
05502                   snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/%d", tm.tm_min % 10);
05503                   res = wait_file(chan,ints,nextmsg,lang);
05504                }
05505             }
05506             if (!res) {
05507                res = wait_file(chan,ints, "digits/minute",lang);
05508             }
05509             break;
05510          case 'P':
05511          case 'p':
05512             /* AM/PM */
05513             if (tm.tm_hour > 11)
05514                snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/p-m");
05515             else
05516                snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/a-m");
05517             res = wait_file(chan,ints,nextmsg,lang);
05518             break;
05519          case 'Q':
05520             /* Shorthand for "Today", "Yesterday", or ABdY */
05521             /* XXX As emphasized elsewhere, this should the native way in your
05522              * language to say the date, with changes in what you say, depending
05523              * upon how recent the date is. XXX */
05524             {
05525                struct timeval now;
05526                struct tm tmnow;
05527                time_t beg_today, tt;
05528 
05529                gettimeofday(&now,NULL);
05530                tt = now.tv_sec;
05531                ast_localtime(&tt,&tmnow,timezone);
05532                /* This might be slightly off, if we transcend a leap second, but never more off than 1 second */
05533                /* In any case, it saves not having to do ast_mktime() */
05534                beg_today = tt - (tmnow.tm_hour * 3600) - (tmnow.tm_min * 60) - (tmnow.tm_sec);
05535                if (beg_today < time) {
05536                   /* Today */
05537                   res = wait_file(chan,ints, "digits/today",lang);
05538                } else if (beg_today - 86400 < time) {
05539                   /* Yesterday */
05540                   res = wait_file(chan,ints, "digits/yesterday",lang);
05541                } else {
05542                   res = ast_say_date_with_format_tw(chan, time, ints, lang, "YBdA", timezone);
05543                }
05544             }
05545             break;
05546          case 'q':
05547             /* Shorthand for "" (today), "Yesterday", A (weekday), or ABdY */
05548             /* XXX As emphasized elsewhere, this should the native way in your
05549              * language to say the date, with changes in what you say, depending
05550              * upon how recent the date is. XXX */
05551             {
05552                struct timeval now;
05553                struct tm tmnow;
05554                time_t beg_today, tt;
05555 
05556                gettimeofday(&now,NULL);
05557                tt = now.tv_sec;
05558                ast_localtime(&tt,&tmnow,timezone);
05559                /* This might be slightly off, if we transcend a leap second, but never more off than 1 second */
05560                /* In any case, it saves not having to do ast_mktime() */
05561                beg_today = tt - (tmnow.tm_hour * 3600) - (tmnow.tm_min * 60) - (tmnow.tm_sec);
05562                if (beg_today < time) {
05563                   /* Today */
05564                } else if ((beg_today - 86400) < time) {
05565                   /* Yesterday */
05566                   res = wait_file(chan,ints, "digits/yesterday",lang);
05567                } else if (beg_today - 86400 * 6 < time) {
05568                   /* Within the last week */
05569                   res = ast_say_date_with_format_tw(chan, time, ints, lang, "A", timezone);
05570                } else {
05571                   res = ast_say_date_with_format_tw(chan, time, ints, lang, "YBdA", timezone);
05572                }
05573             }
05574             break;
05575          case 'R':
05576             res = ast_say_date_with_format_tw(chan, time, ints, lang, "HM", timezone);
05577             break;
05578          case 'S':
05579             /* Seconds */
05580             if (!(tm.tm_sec % 10) || tm.tm_sec < 10) {
05581                if (tm.tm_sec < 10) {
05582                   res = wait_file(chan, ints, "digits/0", lang);
05583                }
05584                snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/%d", tm.tm_sec);
05585                res = wait_file(chan,ints,nextmsg,lang);
05586             } else {
05587                snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/%d", tm.tm_sec - (tm.tm_sec % 10));
05588                res = wait_file(chan,ints,nextmsg,lang);
05589                if (!res) {
05590                   snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/%d", tm.tm_sec % 10);
05591                   res = wait_file(chan,ints,nextmsg,lang);
05592                }
05593             }
05594             if (!res) {
05595                res = wait_file(chan,ints, "digits/second",lang);
05596             }
05597             break;
05598          case 'T':
05599             res = ast_say_date_with_format_tw(chan, time, ints, lang, "HMS", timezone);
05600             break;
05601          case ' ':
05602          case '   ':
05603             /* Just ignore spaces and tabs */
05604          break;
05605          default:
05606             /* Unknown character */
05607             ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Unknown character in datetime format %s: %c at pos %d\n", format, format[offset], offset);
05608       }
05609       /* Jump out on DTMF */
05610       if (res) {
05611          break;
05612       }
05613    }
05614    return res;
05615 }

int ast_say_datetime_de (  struct ast_channel *  chan,
time_t  t,
const char *  ints,
const char *  lang
)  [static]
 

Definition at line 5956 of file say.c.

References ast_say_date, and ast_say_time.

Referenced by say_datetime().

05957 {
05958    struct tm tm;
05959    int res = 0;
05960    localtime_r(&t,&tm);
05961    res = ast_say_date(chan, t, ints, lang);
05962    if (!res) 
05963       ast_say_time(chan, t, ints, lang);
05964    return res;
05965 
05966 }

int ast_say_datetime_en (  struct ast_channel *  chan,
time_t  t,

const char *  lang
)  [static]

References ast_say_number(), ast_streamfile(), and ast_waitstream().

Referenced by say_datetime().

05892 {
05893    struct tm tm;
05894    char fn[256];
05895    int res = 0;
05896    int hour, pm=0;
05897    localtime_r(&t,&tm);
05898    if (!res) {
05899       snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/day-%d", tm.tm_wday);
05900       res = ast_streamfile(chan, fn, lang);
05901       if (!res)
05902          res = ast_waitstream(chan, ints);
05903    }
05904    if (!res) {
05905       snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/mon-%d", tm.tm_mon);
05906       res = ast_streamfile(chan, fn, lang);
05907       if (!res)
05908          res = ast_waitstream(chan, ints);
05909    }
05910    if (!res)
05911       res = ast_say_number(chan, tm.tm_mday, ints, lang, (char *) NULL);
05912 
05913    hour = tm.tm_hour;
05914    if (!hour)
05915       hour = 12;
05916    else if (hour == 12)
05917       pm = 1;
05918    else if (hour > 12) {
05919       hour -= 12;
05920       pm = 1;
05921    }
05922    if (!res)
05923       res = ast_say_number(chan, hour, ints, lang, (char *) NULL);
05924 
05925    if (tm.tm_min > 9) {
05926       if (!res)
05927          res = ast_say_number(chan, tm.tm_min, ints, lang, (char *) NULL);
05928    } else if (tm.tm_min) {
05929       if (!res)
05930          res = ast_streamfile(chan, "digits/oh", lang);
05931       if (!res)
05932          res = ast_waitstream(chan, ints);
05933       if (!res)
05934          res = ast_say_number(chan, tm.tm_min, ints, lang, (char *) NULL);
05935    } else {
05936       if (!res)
05937          res = ast_streamfile(chan, "digits/oclock", lang);
05938       if (!res)
05939          res = ast_waitstream(chan, ints);
05940    }
05941    if (pm) {
05942       if (!res)
05943          res = ast_streamfile(chan, "digits/p-m", lang);
05944    } else {
05945       if (!res)
05946          res = ast_streamfile(chan, "digits/a-m", lang);
05947    }
05948    if (!res)
05949       res = ast_waitstream(chan, ints);
05950    if (!res)
05951       res = ast_say_number(chan, tm.tm_year + 1900, ints, lang, (char *) NULL);
05952    return res;
05953 }

int ast_say_datetime_from_now_en (  struct ast_channel *  chan,
time_t  t,
const char *  ints,
const char *  lang
)  [static]
 

Definition at line 6188 of file say.c.

References ast_say_number(), ast_say_time, ast_streamfile(), and ast_waitstream().

Referenced by say_datetime_from_now().

06189 {
06190    int res=0;
06191    time_t nowt;
06192    int daydiff;
06193    struct tm tm;
06194    struct tm now;
06195    char fn[256];
06196 
06197    time(&nowt);
06198 
06199    localtime_r(&t,&tm);
06200    localtime_r(&nowt,&now);
06201    daydiff = now.tm_yday - tm.tm_yday;
06202    if ((daydiff < 0) || (daydiff > 6)) {
06203       /* Day of month and month */
06204       if (!res) {
06205          snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/mon-%d", tm.tm_mon);
06206          res = ast_streamfile(chan, fn, lang);
06207          if (!res)
06208             res = ast_waitstream(chan, ints);
06209       }
06210       if (!res)
06211          res = ast_say_number(chan, tm.tm_mday, ints, lang, (char *) NULL);
06212 
06213    } else if (daydiff) {
06214       /* Just what day of the week */
06215       if (!res) {
06216          snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/day-%d", tm.tm_wday);
06217          res = ast_streamfile(chan, fn, lang);
06218          if (!res)
06219             res = ast_waitstream(chan, ints);
06220       }
06221    } /* Otherwise, it was today */
06222    if (!res)
06223       res = ast_say_time(chan, t, ints, lang);
06224    return res;
06225 }

int ast_say_datetime_from_now_pt (  struct ast_channel *  chan,

)  [static]
 

Definition at line 6268 of file say.c.

References ast_say_number(), ast_say_time, and wait_file().

Referenced by say_datetime_from_now().

06269 {
06270    int res=0;
06271    time_t nowt;
06272    int daydiff;
06273    struct tm tm;
06274    struct tm now;
06275    char fn[256];
06276 
06277    time(&nowt);
06278 
06279    localtime_r(&t,&tm);
06280    localtime_r(&nowt,&now);
06281    daydiff = now.tm_yday - tm.tm_yday;
06282    if ((daydiff < 0) || (daydiff > 6)) {
06283       /* Day of month and month */
06284       if (!res)
06285          res = ast_say_number(chan, tm.tm_mday, ints, lang, (char *) NULL);
06286       if (!res)
06287          res = wait_file(chan, ints, "digits/pt-de", lang);
06288       snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/mon-%d", tm.tm_mon);
06289       if (!res)
06290          res = wait_file(chan, ints, fn, lang);
06291    
06292    } else if (daydiff) {
06293       /* Just what day of the week */
06294       snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/day-%d", tm.tm_wday);
06295       if (!res)
06296          res = wait_file(chan, ints, fn, lang);
06297    }  /* Otherwise, it was today */
06298    if (!strcasecmp(lang, "pt_BR")) {
06299       if (tm.tm_hour > 1) {
06300          snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/pt-as");
06301       } else {
06302          snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/pt-a");
06303       }
06304       if (!res)
06305          res = wait_file(chan, ints, fn, lang);
06306    } else {
06307       snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/pt-ah");
06308       if (!res)
06309          res = wait_file(chan, ints, fn, lang);
06310       if (tm.tm_hour != 1)
06311       if (!res)
06312          res = wait_file(chan, ints, "digits/pt-sss", lang);
06313       if (!res)
06314          res = ast_say_time(chan, t, ints, lang);
06315    }
06316    return res;
06317 }

06081    } else {
06082       if (!res)
06083          res = ast_streamfile(chan, "digits/oclock", lang);
06084       if (!res)
06085          res = ast_waitstream(chan, ints);
06086    }
06087    if (pm) {
06088       if (!res)
06089          res = ast_streamfile(chan, "digits/p-m", lang);
06090    } else {
06091       if (!res)
06092          res = ast_streamfile(chan, "digits/a-m", lang);
06093    }
06094    if (!res)
06095       res = ast_waitstream(chan, ints);
06096    if (!res)
06097       res = ast_say_number(chan, tm.tm_year + 1900, ints, lang, (char *) NULL);
06098    return res;
06099 }

)  [static]

06144       hour -= 12;
06145       pm = 1;
06146    }

06166    if (!res)
06167       res = ast_waitstream(chan, ints);
06168    return res;

02483 {
02484    /* options can be: '' or 'm' male gender; 'f' female gender; 'n' neuter gender; 'p' plural */

02500    while (!res && num) {
02501       if (num < 0) {
02502          snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/minus"); /* kind of senseless for enumerations, but our best effort for error checking */
02503          if ( num > INT_MIN ) {
02504             num = -num;
02505          } else {
02506             num = 0;
02507          }  
02508       } else if (num < 100 && t) {
02509          snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/and");
02510          t = 0;
02511       } else if (num < 20) {
02512          snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/h-%d%s", num, gender);
02513          num = 0;
02514       } else if (num < 100) {
02515          int ones = num % 10;
02516          if (ones) {
02517             snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/%d-and", ones);
02518             num -= ones;
02519          } else {
02520             snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/h-%d%s", num, gender);
02521             num = 0;
02522          }
02523       } else if (num == 100 && t == 0) {
02524          snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/h-hundred%s", gender);
02525          num = 0;
02526       } else if (num < 1000) {
02527          int hundreds = num / 100;
02528          num = num % 100;
02529          if (hundreds == 1) {
02530             snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/1N");
02531          } else {
02532             snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/%d", hundreds);
02533          }
02534          if (num) {              
02535             snprintf(fna, sizeof(fna), "digits/hundred");
02536          } else {
02537             snprintf(fna, sizeof(fna), "digits/h-hundred%s", gender);
02538          }
02539          t = 1;
02540       } else   if (num < 1000000) {
02541          int thousands = num / 1000;
02542          num = num % 1000;
02543          if (thousands == 1) {
02544             if (num) {              
02545                snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/1N");
02546                snprintf(fna, sizeof(fna), "digits/thousand");
02547             } else {
02548                if (t) {
02549                   snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/1N");
02550                   snprintf(fna, sizeof(fna), "digits/h-thousand%s", gender);
02551                } else {
02552                   snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/h-thousand%s", gender);
02553                }
02554             }
02555          } else {

02557             if (res) {

02559             }
02560             if (num) {              
02561                snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/thousand");
02562             } else {
02563                snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/h-thousand%s", gender);
02564             }
02565          }
02566          t = 1;
02567       } else if (num < 1000000000) {
02568          int millions = num / 1000000;
02569          num = num % 1000000;
02570          if (millions == 1) {
02571             if (num) {              
02572                snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/1F");
02573                snprintf(fna, sizeof(fna), "digits/million");
02574             } else {
02575                snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/1N");
02576                snprintf(fna, sizeof(fna), "digits/h-million%s", gender);

02587             }
02588          }
02589          t = 1;
02590       } else if (num < INT_MAX) {
02591          int billions = num / 1000000000;
02592          num = num % 1000000000;
02593          if (billions == 1) {
02594             if (num) {              
02595                snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/1F");
02596                snprintf(fna, sizeof(fna), "digits/milliard");
02597             } else {

02614          num = 0;
02615       } else {

02617             ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "Number '%d' is too big for me\n", num);
02618          res = -1;
02619       }

02623             if ((audiofd > -1) && (ctrlfd > -1))

02625             else  
02626                res = ast_waitstream(chan, ints);
02627          }

02631                if ((audiofd > -1) && (ctrlfd > -1)) {
02632                   res = ast_waitstream_full(chan, ints, audiofd, ctrlfd);
02633                } else {
02634                   res = ast_waitstream(chan, ints);
02635                }
02636             }
02637             ast_stopstream(chan);
02638             strcpy(fna, "");
02639          }
02640       }
02641    }
02642    return res;
02643 }

00587             snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/1sto");
00588          } else if ( hundered == 2 ) {
00589             snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/2ste");
00590          } else {
00591                res = ast_say_number_full_cz(chan,hundered,ints,language,options,audiofd,ctrlfd);
00592             if (res)
00593                return res;
00594             if (hundered == 3 || hundered == 4) {  
00595                snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/sta");
00596             } else if ( hundered > 4 ) {
00597                snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/set");
00598             }
00599          }
00600          num -= (hundered * 100);
00601       } else { /* num > 1000 */
00602          length = (int)log10(num)+1;  
00603          while ( (length % 3 ) != 1 ) {
00604             length--;      
00605          }
00606          left = num / (exp10_int(length-1));
00607          if ( left == 2 ) {  
00608             switch (length-1) {
00609                case 9: options = "w";  /* 1,000,000,000 gender female */
00610                   break;
00611                default : options = "m"; /* others are male */
00612             }
00613          }
00614          if ( left > 1 )   { /* we dont say "one thousand" but only thousand */
00615             res = ast_say_number_full_cz(chan,left,ints,language,options,audiofd,ctrlfd);
00616             if (res) 
00617                return res;
00618          }
00619          if ( left >= 5 ) { /* >= 5 have the same declesion */
00620             snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/5_E%d",length-1); 
00621          } else if ( left >= 2 && left <= 4 ) {
00622             snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/2-4_E%d",length-1);
00623          } else { /* left == 1 */
00624             snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/1_E%d",length-1);
00625          }
00626          num -= left * (exp10_int(length-1));
00627       }
00628       if (!res) {
00629          if (!ast_streamfile(chan, fn, language)) {
00630             if ((audiofd > -1) && (ctrlfd > -1)) {
00631                res = ast_waitstream_full(chan, ints, audiofd, ctrlfd);
00632             } else {
00633                res = ast_waitstream(chan, ints);
00634             }
00635          }
00636          ast_stopstream(chan);
00637       }
00638    }
00639    return res; 
00640 }

static int ast_say_number_full_da (  struct ast_channel *  chan,
int  num,
const char *  ints,
const char *  language,
const char *  options,
int  audiofd,
int  ctrlfd
)  [static]
 

ast_say_number_full_da: Danish syntax

Definition at line 646 of file say.c.

References ast_log(), ast_say_digits_full(), ast_stopstream(), ast_streamfile(), ast_waitstream(), ast_waitstream_full(), LOG_DEBUG, and option_debug.

Referenced by say_number_full().

00647 {
00648    int res = 0;
00649    int playh = 0;
00650    int playa = 0;
00651    int cn = 1;    /* +1 = commune; -1 = neuter */
00652    char fn[256] = "";
00653    if (!num) 
00654       return ast_say_digits_full(chan, 0,ints, language, audiofd, ctrlfd);
00655 
00656    if (options && !strncasecmp(options, "n",1)) cn = -1;
00657 
00658    while (!res && (num || playh || playa )) {
00659       /* The grammar for Danish numbers is the same as for English except
00660       * for the following:
00661       * - 1 exists in both commune ("en", file "1N") and neuter ("et", file "1")
00662       * - numbers 20 through 99 are said in reverse order, i.e. 21 is
00663       *   "one-and twenty" and 68 is "eight-and sixty".
00664       * - "million" is different in singular and plural form
00665       * - numbers > 1000 with zero as the third digit from last have an
00666       *   "and" before the last two digits, i.e. 2034 is "two thousand and
00667       *   four-and thirty" and 1000012 is "one million and twelve".
00668       */
00669       if (num < 0) {
00670          snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/minus");
00671          if ( num > INT_MIN ) {
00672             num = -num;
00673          } else {
00674             num = 0;
00675          }  
00676       } else if (playh) {
00677          snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/hundred");
00678          playh = 0;
00679       } else if (playa) {
00680          snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/and");
00681          playa = 0;
00682       } else if (num == 1 && cn == -1) {
00683          snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/1N");
00684          num = 0;
00685       } else if (num < 20) {
00686          snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/%d", num);
00687          num = 0;
00688       } else if (num < 100) {
00689          int ones = num % 10;
00690          if (ones) {
00691             snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/%d-and", ones);
00692             num -= ones;
00693          } else {
00694             snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/%d", num);
00695             num = 0;
00696          }
00697       } else {
00698          if (num < 1000) {
00699             int hundreds = num / 100;
00700             if (hundreds == 1)
00701                snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/1N");
00702             else
00703                snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/%d", (num / 100));
00704 
00705             playh++;
00706             num -= 100 * hundreds;
00707             if (num)
00708                playa++;
00709 
00710          } else {
00711             if (num < 1000000) {
00712                res = ast_say_number_full_da(chan, num / 1000, ints, language, "n", audiofd, ctrlfd);
00713                if (res)
00714                   return res;
00715                num = num % 1000;
00716                snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/thousand");
00717             } else {
00718                if (num < 1000000000) {
00719                   int millions = num / 1000000;
00720                   res = ast_say_number_full_da(chan, millions, ints, language, "c", audiofd, ctrlfd);
00721                   if (res)
00722                      return res;
00723                   if (millions == 1)
00724                      snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/million");
00725                   else
00726                      snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/millions");
00727                   num = num % 1000000;
00728                } else {
00729                   if (option_debug)
00730                      ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "Number '%d' is too big for me\n", num);
00731                   res = -1;
00732                }
00733             }
00734             if (num && num < 100)
00735                playa++;
00736          }
00737       }
00738       if (!res) {
00739          if (!ast_streamfile(chan, fn, language)) {
00740             if ((audiofd > -1) && (ctrlfd > -1)) 
00741                res = ast_waitstream_full(chan, ints, audiofd, ctrlfd);
00742             else  
00743                res = ast_waitstream(chan, ints);
00744          }
00745          ast_stopstream(chan);
00746       }
00747    }
00748    return res;
00749 }

)  [static]
 

ast_say_number_full_de: German syntax

Definition at line 760 of file say.c.

References ast_log(), ast_say_digits_full(), ast_stopstream(), ast_streamfile(), ast_waitstream(), ast_waitstream_full(), LOG_DEBUG, mf, and option_debug.

Referenced by ast_say_enumeration_full_da(), ast_say_enumeration_full_de(), and say_number_full().

00761 {
00762    int res = 0, t = 0;
00763    int mf = 1;                            /* +1 = male and neuter; -1 = female */
00764    char fn[256] = "";
00765    char fna[256] = "";
00766    if (!num) 
00767       return ast_say_digits_full(chan, 0,ints, language, audiofd, ctrlfd);
00768 
00769    if (options && (!strncasecmp(options, "f",1)))
00770       mf = -1;
00771 
00772    while (!res && num) {
00773       /* The grammar for German numbers is the same as for English except
00774       * for the following:
00775       * - numbers 20 through 99 are said in reverse order, i.e. 21 is
00776       *   "one-and twenty" and 68 is "eight-and sixty".
00777       * - "one" varies according to gender
00778       * - 100 is 'hundert', however all other instances are 'ein hundert'
00779       * - 1000 is 'tausend', however all other instances are 'ein tausend'
00780       * - 1000000 is always 'eine million'
00781       * - "million" is different in singular and plural form
00782       */
00783       if (num < 0) {
00784          snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/minus");
00785          if ( num > INT_MIN ) {
00786             num = -num;
00787          } else {
00788             num = 0;
00789          }  
00790       } else if (num < 100 && t) {
00791          snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/and");
00792          t = 0;
00793       } else if (num == 1 && mf == -1) {
00794          snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/%dF", num);
00795          num = 0;
00796       } else if (num < 20) {
00797          snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/%d", num);
00798          num = 0;
00799       } else if (num < 100) {
00800          int ones = num % 10;
00801          if (ones) {
00802             snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/%d-and", ones);
00803             num -= ones;
00804          } else {
00805             snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/%d", num);
00806             num = 0;
00807          }
00808       } else if (num == 100 && t == 0) {
00809          snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/hundred");
00810          num = 0;
00811       } else if (num < 1000) {
00812          int hundreds = num / 100;
00813          num = num % 100;
00814          if (hundreds == 1) {
00815             snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/1N");
00816          } else {
00817             snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/%d", hundreds);
00818          }
00819          snprintf(fna, sizeof(fna), "digits/hundred");
00820          t = 1;
00821       } else if (num == 1000 && t == 0) {
00822          snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/thousand");
00823          num = 0;
00824       } else   if (num < 1000000) {
00825          int thousands = num / 1000;
00826          num = num % 1000;
00827          t = 1;
00828          if (thousands == 1) {
00829             snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/1N");
00830             snprintf(fna, sizeof(fna), "digits/thousand");
00831          } else {
00832             res = ast_say_number_full_de(chan, thousands, ints, language, options, audiofd, ctrlfd);
00833             if (res)
00834                return res;
00835             snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/thousand");
00836          }
00837       } else if (num < 1000000000) {
00838          int millions = num / 1000000;
00839          num = num % 1000000;
00840          t = 1;
00841          if (millions == 1) {
00842             snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/1F");
00843             snprintf(fna, sizeof(fna), "digits/million");
00844          } else {
00845             res = ast_say_number_full_de(chan, millions, ints, language, options, audiofd, ctrlfd);
00846             if (res)
00847                return res;
00848             snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/millions");
00849          }
00850       } else if (num <= INT_MAX) {
00851          int billions = num / 1000000000;
00852          num = num % 1000000000;
00853          t = 1;
00854          if (billions == 1) {
00855             snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/1F");
00856             snprintf(fna, sizeof(fna), "digits/milliard");
00857          } else {
00858             res = ast_say_number_full_de(chan, billions, ints, language, options, audiofd, ctrlfd);
00859             if (res) {
00860                return res;
00861             }
00862             snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/milliards");
00863          }
00864       } else {
00865          if (option_debug)
00866             ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "Number '%d' is too big for me\n", num);
00867          res = -1;
00868       }
00869       if (!res) {
00870          if (!ast_streamfile(chan, fn, language)) {
00871             if ((audiofd > -1) && (ctrlfd > -1)) 
00872                res = ast_waitstream_full(chan, ints, audiofd, ctrlfd);
00873             else  
00874                res = ast_waitstream(chan, ints);
00875          }
00876          ast_stopstream(chan);
00877          if (!res) {
00878             if (strlen(fna) != 0 && !ast_streamfile(chan, fna, language)) {
00879                if ((audiofd > -1) && (ctrlfd > -1))
00880                   res = ast_waitstream_full(chan, ints, audiofd, ctrlfd);
00881                else
00882                   res = ast_waitstream(chan, ints);
00883             }
00884             ast_stopstream(chan);
00885             strcpy(fna, "");
00886          }
00887       }
00888    }
00889    return res;
00890 }

00982       return ast_say_digits_full(chan, 0,ints, language, audiofd, ctrlfd);

00985       if (!strncasecmp(options, "f",1))
00986          mf = -1;
00987       else if (!strncasecmp(options, "m", 1))
00988          mf = 1;
00989    }
00990

00992       if (num < 0) {
00993          snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/minus");
00994          if ( num > INT_MIN ) {
00995             num = -num;
00996          } else {
00997             num = 0;
00998          }  
00999       } else if (playa) {
01000          snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/and");
01001          playa = 0;
01002       } else if (num == 1) {
01003          if (mf < 0)
01004             snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/%dF", num);
01005          else if (mf > 0)
01006             snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/%dM", num);
01007          else 
01008             snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/%d", num);
01009          num = 0;
01010       } else if (num < 31) {
01011          snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/%d", num);
01012          num = 0;
01013       } else if (num < 100) {
01014          snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/%d", (num/10)*10);
01015          num -= ((num/10)*10);
01016          if (num)
01017             playa++;
01018       } else if (num == 100) {
01019          snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/100");
01020          num = 0;
01021       } else if (num < 200) {
01022          snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/100-and");
01023          num -= 100;
01024       } else {
01025          if (num < 1000) {
01026             snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/%d", (num/100)*100);
01027             num -= ((num/100)*100);
01028          } else if (num < 2000) {
01029             num = num % 1000;
01030             snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/thousand");
01031          } else {
01032             if (num < 1000000) {
01033                res = ast_say_number_full_es(chan, num / 1000, ints, language, options, audiofd, ctrlfd);
01034                if (res)
01035                   return res;
01036                num = num % 1000;
01037                snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/thousand");
01038             } else {
01039                if (num < 2147483640) {
01040                   if ((num/1000000) == 1) {
01041                      res = ast_say_number_full_es(chan, num / 1000000, ints, language, "M", audiofd, ctrlfd);
01042                      if (res)
01043                         return res;
01044                      snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/million");
01045                   } else {
01046                      res = ast_say_number_full_es(chan, num / 1000000, ints, language, options, audiofd, ctrlfd);
01047                      if (res)
01048                         return res;
01049                      snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/millions");
01050                   }
01051                   num = num % 1000000;
01052                } else {
01053                   if (option_debug)
01054                      ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "Number '%d' is too big for me\n", num);
01055                   res = -1;
01056                }
01057             }
01058          }
01059       }
01060

01062          if (!ast_streamfile(chan, fn, language)) {
01063             if ((audiofd > -1) && (ctrlfd > -1))
01064                res = ast_waitstream_full(chan, ints, audiofd, ctrlfd);
01065             else
01066                res = ast_waitstream(chan, ints);
01067          }
01068          ast_stopstream(chan);
01069 
01070       }
01071          
01072    }
01073    return res;
01074 }

01086    char fn[256] = "";
01087    if (!num) 
01088       return ast_say_digits_full(chan, 0,ints, language, audiofd, ctrlfd);
01089    
01090    if (options && !strncasecmp(options, "f",1))
01091       mf = -1;
01092 
01093    while (!res && (num || playh || playa)) {
01094       if (num < 0) {
01095          snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/minus");
01096          if ( num > INT_MIN ) {
01097             num = -num;
01098          } else {
01099             num = 0;
01100          }  
01101       } else if (playh) {
01102          snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/hundred");
01103          playh = 0;
01104       } else if (playa) {
01105          snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/et");
01106          playa = 0;
01107       } else if (num == 1) {
01108          if (mf < 0)
01109             snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/%dF", num);
01110          else
01111             snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/%d", num);
01112          num = 0;
01113       } else if (num < 21) {
01114          snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/%d", num);
01115          num = 0;
01116       } else if (num < 70) {
01117          snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/%d", (num/10)*10);
01118          if ((num % 10) == 1) playa++;
01119          num = num % 10;
01120       } else if (num < 80) {
01121          snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/60");
01122          if ((num % 10) == 1) playa++;
01123          num -= 60;
01124       } else if (num < 100) {
01125          snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/80");
01126          num = num - 80;
01127       } else if (num < 200) {
01128          snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/hundred");
01129          num = num - 100;
01130       } else if (num < 1000) {
01131          snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/%d", (num/100));
01132          playh++;
01133          num = num % 100;
01134       } else if (num < 2000) {
01135          snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/thousand");
01136          num = num - 1000;
01137       } else if (num < 1000000) {
01138          res = ast_say_number_full_fr(chan, num / 1000, ints, language, options, audiofd, ctrlfd);
01139          if (res)
01140             return res;
01141          snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/thousand");
01142          num = num % 1000;
01143       } else   if (num < 1000000000) {
01144          res = ast_say_number_full_fr(chan, num / 1000000, ints, language, options, audiofd, ctrlfd);
01145          if (res)
01146             return res;
01147          snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/million");
01148          num = num % 1000000;
01149       } else {
01150          if (option_debug)
01151             ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "Number '%d' is too big for me\n", num);
01152          res = -1;
01153       }
01154       if (!res) {
01155          if (!ast_streamfile(chan, fn, language)) {
01156             if ((audiofd > -1) && (ctrlfd > -1))
01157                res = ast_waitstream_full(chan, ints, audiofd, ctrlfd);
01158             else
01159                res = ast_waitstream(chan, ints);
01160          }
01161          ast_stopstream(chan);
01162       }
01163    }
01164    return res;
01165 }

const char *  language,
const char *  options,
int  audiofd,
int  ctrlfd
)  [static]

01234       /* first type of work: play a second sound. In this loop
01235        * we can only play one sound file at a time. Thus playing 
01236        * a second one requires repeating the loop just for the 
01237        * second file. The variable 'state' remembers where we were.
01238        * state==0 is the normal mode and it means that we continue

01267          state=2;

01269          snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/2hundred");
01270          num = num - 200;
01271          state=2;

ast_say_number_full_hu: Hungarian syntax

01323 {
01324    int res = 0;
01325    int playh = 0;

01327    if (!num) 
01328       return ast_say_digits_full(chan, 0,ints, language, audiofd, ctrlfd);
01329 
01330    /*
01331    Hungarian support
01332    like english, except numbers up to 29 are from 2 words.
01333    10 and first word of 1[1-9] and 20 and first word of 2[1-9] are different.
01334    */
01335 
01336    while(!res && (num || playh)) {
01337       if (num < 0) {
01338          snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/minus");
01339          if ( num > INT_MIN ) {
01340             num = -num;
01341          } else {
01342             num = 0;
01343          }  
01344       } else if (playh) {
01345          snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/hundred");
01346          playh = 0;
01347       } else if (num < 11 || num == 20) {
01348          snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/%d", num);
01349          num = 0;
01350       } else if (num < 20) {
01351          snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/10en");
01352          num = (num - 10);
01353       } else if (num < 30) {
01354          snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/20on");
01355          num = (num - 20);

01357          snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/%d", (num /10) * 10);
01358          num -= ((num / 10) * 10);
01359       } else {
01360          if (num < 1000){
01361             snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/%d", (num/100));
01362             playh++;
01363             num -= ((num / 100) * 100);
01364          } else {
01365             if (num < 1000000) { /* 1,000,000 */

01368                   return res;
01369                num = num % 1000;
01370                snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/thousand");

01372                if (num < 1000000000) { /* 1,000,000,000 */
01373                   res = ast_say_number_full_hu(chan, num / 1000000, ints, language, audiofd, ctrlfd);
01374                   if (res)
01375                      return res;
01376                   num = num % 1000000;
01377                   snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/million");
01378                } else {
01379                   ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "Number '%d' is too big for me\n", num);
01380                   res = -1;
01381                }
01382             }
01383          }
01384       }

01390                res = ast_waitstream(chan, ints);
01391          }
01392          ast_stopstream(chan);

01395    return res;

ast_say_number_full_it: Italian

Definition at line 1399 of file say.c.

References ast_log(), ast_say_digits_full(), ast_stopstream(), ast_streamfile(), ast_waitstream(), ast_waitstream_full(), LOG_DEBUG, and option_debug.

Referenced by say_number_full().

01400 {
01401    int res = 0;
01402    int playh = 0;
01403    int tempnum = 0;
01404    char fn[256] = "";
01405 
01406    if (!num)
01407       return ast_say_digits_full(chan, 0,ints, language, audiofd, ctrlfd);
01408 
01409       /*
01410       Italian support
01411 
01412       Like english, numbers up to 20 are a single 'word', and others
01413       compound, but with exceptions.
01414       For example 21 is not twenty-one, but there is a single word in 'it'.
01415       Idem for 28 (ie when a the 2nd part of a compund number
01416       starts with a vowel)
01417 
01418       There are exceptions also for hundred, thousand and million.
01419       In english 100 = one hundred, 200 is two hundred.
01420       In italian 100 = cento , like to say hundred (without one),
01421       200 and more are like english.
01422       
01423       Same applies for thousand:
01424       1000 is one thousand in en, 2000 is two thousand.
01425       In it we have 1000 = mille , 2000 = 2 mila 
01426 
01427       For million(s) we use the plural, if more than one
01428       Also, one million is abbreviated in it, like on-million,
01429       or 'un milione', not 'uno milione'.
01430       So the right file is provided.
01431       */
01432 
01433    while (!res && (num || playh)) {
01434          if (num < 0) {
01435             snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/minus");
01436             if ( num > INT_MIN ) {
01437                num = -num;
01438             } else {
01439                num = 0;
01440             }  
01441          } else if (playh) {
01442             snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/hundred");
01443             playh = 0;
01444          } else if (num < 20) {
01445             snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/%d", num);
01446             num = 0;
01447          } else if (num == 21) {
01448             snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/%d", num);
01449             num = 0;
01450          } else if (num == 28) {
01451             snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/%d", num);
01452             num = 0;
01453          } else if (num == 31) {
01454             snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/%d", num);
01455             num = 0;
01456          } else if (num == 38) {
01457             snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/%d", num);
01458             num = 0;
01459          } else if (num == 41) {
01460             snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/%d", num);
01461             num = 0;
01462          } else if (num == 48) {
01463             snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/%d", num);
01464             num = 0;
01465          } else if (num == 51) {
01466             snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/%d", num);
01467             num = 0;
01468          } else if (num == 58) {
01469             snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/%d", num);
01470             num = 0;
01471          } else if (num == 61) {
01472             snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/%d", num);
01473             num = 0;
01474          } else if (num == 68) {
01475             snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/%d", num);
01476             num = 0;
01477          } else if (num == 71) {
01478             snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/%d", num);
01479             num = 0;
01480          } else if (num == 78) {
01481             snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/%d", num);
01482             num = 0;
01483          } else if (num == 81) {
01484             snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/%d", num);
01485             num = 0;
01486          } else if (num == 88) {
01487             snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/%d", num);
01488             num = 0;
01489          } else if (num == 91) {
01490             snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/%d", num);
01491             num = 0;
01492          } else if (num == 98) {
01493             snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/%d", num);
01494             num = 0;
01495          } else if (num < 100) {
01496             snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/%d", (num /10) * 10);
01497             num -= ((num / 10) * 10);
01498          } else {
01499             if (num < 1000) {
01500                if ((num / 100) > 1) {
01501                   snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/%d", (num/100));
01502                   playh++;
01503                } else {
01504                   snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/hundred");
01505                }
01506                num -= ((num / 100) * 100);
01507             } else {
01508                if (num < 1000000) { /* 1,000,000 */
01509                   if ((num/1000) > 1)
01510                      res = ast_say_number_full_it(chan, num / 1000, ints, language, audiofd, ctrlfd);
01511                   if (res)
01512                      return res;
01513                   tempnum = num;
01514                   num = num % 1000;
01515                   if ((tempnum / 1000) < 2)
01516                      snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/thousand");
01517                   else /* for 1000 it says mille, for >1000 (eg 2000) says mila */
01518                      snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/thousands");
01519                } else {
01520                   if (num < 1000000000) { /* 1,000,000,000 */
01521                      if ((num / 1000000) > 1)
01522                         res = ast_say_number_full_it(chan, num / 1000000, ints, language, audiofd, ctrlfd);
01523                      if (res)
01524                         return res;
01525                      tempnum = num;
01526                      num = num % 1000000;
01527                      if ((tempnum / 1000000) < 2)
01528                         snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/million");
01529                      else
01530                         snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/millions");
01531                   } else {
01532                      if (option_debug)
01533                         ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "Number '%d' is too big for me\n", num);
01534                      res = -1;
01535                   }
01536                }
01537             }
01538          }
01539          if (!res) {
01540             if (!ast_streamfile(chan, fn, language)) {
01541                if ((audiofd > -1) && (ctrlfd > -1))
01542                   res = ast_waitstream_full(chan, ints, audiofd, ctrlfd);
01543                else
01544                   res = ast_waitstream(chan, ints);
01545             }
01546             ast_stopstream(chan);
01547          }
01548       }
01549    return res;
01550 }

)  [static]
 

ast_say_number_full_nl: dutch syntax

01556 {
01557    int res = 0;
01558    int playh = 0;
01559    int units = 0;
01560    char fn[256] = "";
01561    if (!num) 
01562       return ast_say_digits_full(chan, 0,ints, language, audiofd, ctrlfd);
01563    while (!res && (num || playh )) {
01564       if (num < 0) {
01565          snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/minus");
01566          if ( num > INT_MIN ) {
01567             num = -num;
01568          } else {
01569             num = 0;
01570          }  
01571       } else if (playh) {
01572          snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/hundred");
01573          playh = 0;
01574       } else if (num < 20) {
01575          snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/%d", num);
01576          num = 0;
01577       } else if (num < 100) {
01578          units = num % 10;
01579          if (units > 0) {
01580             res = ast_say_number_full_nl(chan, units, ints, language, audiofd, ctrlfd);
01581             if (res)
01582                return res;
01583             num = num - units;
01584             snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/nl-en");
01585          } else {
01586             snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/%d", num - units);
01587             num = 0;
01588          }
01589       } else {
01590          if (num < 1000) {
01591             snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/%d", (num/100));
01592             playh++;
01593             num -= ((num / 100) * 100);
01594          } else {
01595             if (num < 1000000) { /* 1,000,000 */
01596                res = ast_say_number_full_en(chan, num / 1000, ints, language, audiofd, ctrlfd);
01597                if (res)
01598                   return res;
01599                num = num % 1000;
01600                snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/thousand");
01601             } else {
01602                if (num < 1000000000) { /* 1,000,000,000 */
01603                   res = ast_say_number_full_en(chan, num / 1000000, ints, language, audiofd, ctrlfd);
01604                   if (res)
01605                      return res;
01606                   num = num % 1000000;
01607                   snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/million");
01608                } else {
01609                   if (option_debug)
01610                      ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "Number '%d' is too big for me\n", num);
01611                   res = -1;
01612                }
01613             }
01614          }
01615       }
01616 
01617       if (!res) {
01618          if (!ast_streamfile(chan, fn, language)) {
01619             if ((audiofd > -1) && (ctrlfd > -1))
01620                res = ast_waitstream_full(chan, ints, audiofd, ctrlfd);
01621             else
01622                res = ast_waitstream(chan, ints);
01623          }
01624          ast_stopstream(chan);
01625       }
01626    }
01627    return res;
01628 }
