ast_say_number_full_no: Norwegian syntax

Definition at line 1634 of file say.c.

References ast_log(), ast_say_digits_full(), ast_stopstream(), ast_streamfile(), ast_waitstream(), ast_waitstream_full(), LOG_DEBUG, and option_debug.

Referenced by say_number_full().

01635 {
01636    int res = 0;
01637    int playh = 0;
01638    int playa = 0;
01639    int cn = 1;    /* +1 = commune; -1 = neuter */
01640    char fn[256] = "";
01641    
01642    if (!num) 
01643       return ast_say_digits_full(chan, 0,ints, language, audiofd, ctrlfd);
01644    
01645    if (options && !strncasecmp(options, "n",1)) cn = -1;
01646 
01647    while (!res && (num || playh || playa )) {
01648       /* The grammar for Norwegian numbers is the same as for English except
01649       * for the following:
01650       * - 1 exists in both commune ("en", file "1") and neuter ("ett", file "1N")
01651       *   "and" before the last two digits, i.e. 2034 is "two thousand and
01652       *   thirty-four" and 1000012 is "one million and twelve".
01653       */
01654       if (num < 0) {
01655          snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/minus");
01656          if ( num > INT_MIN ) {
01657             num = -num;
01658          } else {
01659             num = 0;
01660          }  
01661       } else if (playh) {
01662          snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/hundred");
01663          playh = 0;
01664       } else if (playa) {
01665          snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/and");
01666          playa = 0;
01667       } else if (num == 1 && cn == -1) {
01668          snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/1N");
01669          num = 0;
01670       } else if (num < 20) {
01671          snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/%d", num);
01672          num = 0;
01673       } else if (num < 100) {
01674          snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/%d", (num /10) * 10);
01675          num -= ((num / 10) * 10);
01676       } else if (num < 1000) {
01677          int hundreds = num / 100;
01678          if (hundreds == 1)
01679             snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/1N");
01680          else
01681             snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/%d", (num / 100));
01682 
01683          playh++;
01684          num -= 100 * hundreds;
01685          if (num)
01686             playa++;
01687       } else   if (num < 1000000) {
01688          res = ast_say_number_full_no(chan, num / 1000, ints, language, "n", audiofd, ctrlfd);
01689          if (res)
01690             return res;
01691          snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/thousand");
01692          num = num % 1000;
01693          if (num && num < 100)
01694             playa++;
01695       } else   if (num < 1000000000) {
01696             int millions = num / 1000000;
01697             res = ast_say_number_full_no(chan, millions, ints, language, "c", audiofd, ctrlfd);
01698             if (res)
01699                return res;
01700             snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/million");
01701             num = num % 1000000;
01702             if (num && num < 100)
01703                playa++;
01704       } else {
01705             if (option_debug)
01706                ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "Number '%d' is too big for me\n", num);
01707             res = -1;
01708       }
01709       
01710       if (!res) {
01711          if (!ast_streamfile(chan, fn, language)) {
01712             if ((audiofd > -1) && (ctrlfd > -1)) 
01713                res = ast_waitstream_full(chan, ints, audiofd, ctrlfd);
01714             else  
01715                res = ast_waitstream(chan, ints);
01716          }
01717          ast_stopstream(chan);
01718       }
01719    }
01720    return res;
01721 }

02025    int res = 0;

02027    int mf = 1;                            /* +1 = male; -1 = female */

02029 
02030    if (!num) 
02031       return ast_say_digits_full(chan, 0,ints, language, audiofd, ctrlfd);
02032 
02033    if (options && !strncasecmp(options, "f",1))
02034       mf = -1;

02036    while (!res && num ) {
02037       if (num < 0) {
02038          snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/minus");
02039          if ( num > INT_MIN ) {
02040             num = -num;
02041          } else {
02042             num = 0;
02043          }  
02044       } else if (num < 20) {
02045          if ((num == 1 || num == 2) && (mf < 0))
02046             snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/%dF", num);
02047          else
02048             snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/%d", num);
02049          num = 0;
02050       } else if (num < 100) {
02051          snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/%d", (num / 10) * 10);
02052          if (num % 10)
02053             playh = 1;
02054          num = num % 10;
02055       } else if (num < 1000) {
02056          if (num == 100)
02057             snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/100");
02058          else if (num < 200)
02059             snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/100E");
02060          else {
02061             if (mf < 0 && num > 199)
02062                snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/%dF", (num / 100) * 100);
02063             else
02064                snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/%d", (num / 100) * 100);
02065             if (num % 100)
02066                playh = 1;
02067          }
02068          num = num % 100;
02069       } else if (num < 1000000) {
02070          if (num > 1999) {
02071             res = ast_say_number_full_pt(chan, (num / 1000) * mf, ints, language, options, audiofd, ctrlfd);
02072             if (res)
02073                return res;
02074          }
02075          snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/1000");
02076          if ((num % 1000) && ((num % 1000) < 100  || !(num % 100)))
02077             playh = 1;
02078          num = num % 1000;
02079       } else if (num < 1000000000) {
02080          res = ast_say_number_full_pt(chan, (num / 1000000), ints, language, options, audiofd, ctrlfd );
02081          if (res)
02082             return res;
02083          if (num < 2000000)
02084             snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/1000000");
02085          else
02086             snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/1000000S");
02087  
02088          if ((num % 1000000) &&
02089             /* no thousands */
02090             ((!((num / 1000) % 1000) && ((num % 1000) < 100 || !(num % 100))) ||
02091             /* no hundreds and below */
02092             (!(num % 1000) && (((num / 1000) % 1000) < 100 || !((num / 1000) % 100))) ) )
02093             playh = 1;
02094          num = num % 1000000;
02095       } else {
02096          /* number is too big */
02097          ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Number '%d' is too big to say.", num);
02098          res = -1;
02099       }
02100       if (!res) {
02101          if (!ast_streamfile(chan, fn, language)) {
02102             if ((audiofd > -1) && (ctrlfd > -1))
02103                res = ast_waitstream_full(chan, ints, audiofd, ctrlfd);  
02104             else
02105                res = ast_waitstream(chan, ints);
02106          }
02107          ast_stopstream(chan);
02108       }
02109       if (!res && playh) {
02110          res = wait_file(chan, ints, "digits/pt-e", language);
02111          ast_stopstream(chan);
02112          playh = 0;
02113       }
02114    }
02115    return res;
02116 }

static int ast_say_number_full_ru (  struct ast_channel *  chan,
int  num,
const char *  ints,
const char *  language,
const char *  options,
int  audiofd,
int  ctrlfd
)  [static]
 

ast_say_number_full_ru: Russian syntax additional files: n00.gsm (one hundred, two hundred, ...) thousand.gsm million.gsm thousands-i.gsm (tisyachi) million-a.gsm (milliona) thousands.gsm millions.gsm 1f.gsm (odna) 2f.gsm (dve)

where 'n' from 1 to 9

References ast_log(), ast_say_digits_full(), ast_stopstream(), ast_streamfile(), ast_waitstream(), ast_waitstream_full(), get_lastdigits_ru(), LOG_DEBUG, and option_debug.

02287    int res = 0;
02288    int lastdigits = 0;

02290    if (!num) 
02291       return ast_say_digits_full(chan, 0,ints, language, audiofd, ctrlfd);

02293    while (!res && (num)) {
02294       if (num < 0) {
02295          snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/minus");
02296          if ( num > INT_MIN ) {
02297             num = -num;
02298          } else {
02299             num = 0;
02300          }  
02301       } else   if (num < 20) {
02302          if (options && strlen(options) == 1 && num < 3) {
02303              snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/%d%s", num, options);
02304          } else {
02305                 snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/%d", num);
02306          }
02307          num = 0;
02308       } else   if (num < 100) {
02309          snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/%d", num - (num % 10));
02310          num %= 10;
02311       } else   if (num < 1000){
02312          snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/%d", num - (num % 100));
02313          num %= 100;
02314       } else   if (num < 1000000) { /* 1,000,000 */
02315          lastdigits = get_lastdigits_ru(num / 1000);
02316          /* say thousands */
02317          if (lastdigits < 3) {
02318             res = ast_say_number_full_ru(chan, num / 1000, ints, language, "f", audiofd, ctrlfd);
02319          } else {
02320             res = ast_say_number_full_ru(chan, num / 1000, ints, language, NULL, audiofd, ctrlfd);
02321          }
02322          if (res)
02323             return res;
02324          if (lastdigits == 1) {
02325             snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/thousand");
02326          } else if (lastdigits > 1 && lastdigits < 5) {
02327             snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/thousands-i");
02328          } else {

02330          }
02331          num %= 1000;
02332       } else   if (num < 1000000000) { /* 1,000,000,000 */
02333          lastdigits = get_lastdigits_ru(num / 1000000);
02334          /* say millions */
02335          res = ast_say_number_full_ru(chan, num / 1000000, ints, language, NULL, audiofd, ctrlfd);
02336          if (res)
02337             return res;
02338          if (lastdigits == 1) {
02339             snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/million");
02340          } else if (lastdigits > 1 && lastdigits < 5) {
02341             snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/million-a");
02342          } else {
02343             snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/millions");
02344          }
02345          num %= 1000000;
02346       } else {
02347          if (option_debug)
02348             ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "Number '%d' is too big for me\n", num);
02349          res = -1;
02350       }
02351       if (!res) {
02352          if (!ast_streamfile(chan, fn, language)) {
02353             if ((audiofd  > -1) && (ctrlfd > -1))
02354                res = ast_waitstream_full(chan, ints, audiofd, ctrlfd);
02355             else
02356                res = ast_waitstream(chan, ints);
02357          }
02358          ast_stopstream(chan);
02359       }
02360    }
02361    return res;
02362 }

int  num,
const char *  ints,
const char *  language,
const char *  options,
int  audiofd,
int  ctrlfd
)  [static]
 

ast_say_number_full_se: Swedish syntax

Definition at line 2119 of file say.c.

References ast_log(), ast_say_digits_full(), ast_stopstream(), ast_streamfile(), ast_waitstream(), ast_waitstream_full(), LOG_DEBUG, and option_debug.

Referenced by say_number_full().

02120 {
02121    int res = 0;
02122    int playh = 0;
02123    char fn[256] = "";
02124    int cn = 1;    /* +1 = commune; -1 = neuter */
02125    if (!num) 
02126       return ast_say_digits_full(chan, 0,ints, language, audiofd, ctrlfd);
02127    if (options && !strncasecmp(options, "n",1)) cn = -1;
02128 
02129    while (!res && (num || playh)) {
02130       if (num < 0) {
02131          snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/minus");
02132          if ( num > INT_MIN ) {
02133             num = -num;
02134          } else {
02135             num = 0;
02136          }  
02137       } else if (playh) {
02138          snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/hundred");
02139          playh = 0;
02140       } else if (num < 20) {
02141          snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/%d", num);
02142          num = 0;
02143       } else if (num < 100) {
02144          snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/%d", (num /10) * 10);
02145          num -= ((num / 10) * 10);
02146       } else if (num == 1 && cn == -1) {  /* En eller ett? */
02147          snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/1N");
02148          num = 0;
02149       } else {
02150          if (num < 1000){
02151             snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/%d", (num/100));
02152             playh++;
02153             num -= ((num / 100) * 100);
02154          } else {
02155             if (num < 1000000) { /* 1,000,000 */
02156                res = ast_say_number_full_se(chan, num / 1000, ints, language, options, audiofd, ctrlfd);
02157                if (res) {
02158                   return res;
02159                }
02160                num = num % 1000;
02161                snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/thousand");
02162             } else {
02163                if (num < 1000000000) { /* 1,000,000,000 */
02164                   res = ast_say_number_full_se(chan, num / 1000000, ints, language, options, audiofd, ctrlfd);
02165                   if (res) {
02166                      return res;
02167                   }
02168                   num = num % 1000000;
02169                   snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/million");
02170                } else {
02171                   if (option_debug)
02172                      ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "Number '%d' is too big for me\n", num);
02173                   res = -1;
02174                }
02175             }
02176          }
02177       }
02178       if (!res) {
02179          if (!ast_streamfile(chan, fn, language)) {
02180             if ((audiofd > -1) && (ctrlfd > -1))
02181                res = ast_waitstream_full(chan, ints, audiofd, ctrlfd);
02182             else
02183                res = ast_waitstream(chan, ints);
02184             ast_stopstream(chan);
02185          }
02186       }
02187    }
02188    return res;
02189 }

05648 {

05651    int hour, pm=0;

05653    hour = tm.tm_hour;
05654    if (!hour)
05655       hour = 12;
05656    else if (hour == 12)
05657       pm = 1;
05658    else if (hour > 12) {
05659       hour -= 12;
05660       pm = 1;
05661    }

05682       if (!res)
05683          res = ast_streamfile(chan, "digits/p-m", lang);
05684    } else {
05685       if (!res)
05686          res = ast_streamfile(chan, "digits/a-m", lang);
05687    }
05688    if (!res)
05689       res = ast_waitstream(chan, ints);
05690    return res;

06900       if (remainder == 0) {
06901          ast_translate_number_ge(digit, res, res_len);
06902          strncat(res, " 1000000000", res_len - strlen(res) - 1);
06903          return res;
06904       }
06905 
06906       ast_translate_number_ge(digit, res, res_len);
06907       strncat(res, " 1000000000_ ", res_len - strlen(res) - 1);
06908       return ast_translate_number_ge(remainder, res, res_len);
06909 
06910    }
06911 
06912    return res;
06913 
06914 }

00420    } else if (!strcasecmp(language, "es") || !strcasecmp(language, "mx")) {   /* Spanish syntax */

00422    } else if (!strcasecmp(language, "fr") ) {   /* French syntax */
00423       return(ast_say_number_full_fr(chan, num, ints, language, options, audiofd, ctrlfd));
00424    } else if (!strcasecmp(language, "he") ) {   /* Hebrew syntax */
00425       return(ast_say_number_full_he(chan, num, ints, language, options, audiofd, ctrlfd));
00426    } else if (!strcasecmp(language, "hu") ) {   /* Hungarian syntax */

00438    } else if (!strcasecmp(language, "tw") || !strcasecmp(language, "zh") ) {  /* Taiwanese / Chinese syntax */

00440    } else if (!strcasecmp(language, "gr") ) {   /* Greek syntax */
00441       return(ast_say_number_full_gr(chan, num, ints, language, audiofd, ctrlfd));
00442    } else if (!strcasecmp(language, "ru") ) {   /* Russian syntax */
00443       return(ast_say_number_full_ru(chan, num, ints, language, options, audiofd, ctrlfd));
00444    } else if (!strcasecmp(language, "ge") ) {   /* Georgian syntax */
00445       return(ast_say_number_full_ge(chan, num, ints, language, options, audiofd, ctrlfd));
00446    }
00447 
00448    /* Default to english */
00449    return(ast_say_number_full_en(chan, num, ints, language, audiofd, ctrlfd));
00450 }

00180          break;

00205       num++;

00207
